Circuitry damaged due to sudden network overload
Protective measure in the event of an explosion
Leon Rinder - Militech Armed Forces deserter, AWOL for 8 years, former member of BARGHEST terrorist organization
Mural commemorating the victims of the Leon Rinder attack
Owned by the scav Nika Yanovich
Former BARGHEST soldier; deserted from Militech army

A NetWatch agent under cover as a mole within the Voodoo Boys of Dogtown. His mission: investigate the gang's practice of hacking the implants of people who refuse to do their bidding, often resulting in their deaths.\nDespite spending many long months in the criminal underworld, Alan has not shown any inclination to switch sides. Some say his strong moral backbone is what keeps him on the straight and narrow; others, that it's his sheer ambition and obsessive need to rise up the corp's ranks.\nOne thing is certain - if the clandestine op proves successful, Alan Noël's advancement up the corporate hierarchy is all but guaranteed.

Ana Friedman, like a bald hairdresser or a cobbler who refuses to wear shoes, is an excellent analyst who makes terrible decisions in her personal life. She has been working for the Federative Republic of Brazil's intelligence agency for several years and truly values her job. Two reasons: the work gives her an adrenaline kick like no other, and she gets to read about it the next day in the morning screamsheets.\nIt's addictive, especially when trying to forget about a failed marriage. Sometimes it's just easier to analyze data on the movements of hostile corporations in the NUSA than to deal with life's problems.

The chief and only surgeon at the Haven clinic on Montaña de Oro Ave. It's not clear how he learned his trade or where he worked before, but the unbroken composure he maintains in any situation would suggest a field hospital after a bloody, hopeless battle.\n\nEmpathy is not Anderson's strong point, but it'd be wrong to consider him devoid of feeling. The very fact that he has chosen to devote his skills to serving the poorest residents of Dogtown speaks volumes. Which begs the question... why?

Bill is the epitome of mediocrity. He has mediocre dreams, mediocre needs and his overall life is pretty, well... mediocre. His attempts to break out of mediocrity are plain to see. He joined the NCPD because a friend said he should and Bill never learned how to say "No." Bill's mediocrity turned out to be exactly what the NCPD was looking for.\nAt work, Bill met his love, muse and confidant - Stella. Occasionally, they manage to time their shifts so that they can spend an evening together in their small unit in a megablock. Bill then looks at Stella and ponders, "Am I good enough for her?"

A sharpshooter from an elite SovOil unit with one hundred and sixty-seven confirmed kills, visual implants in full synchronization with Smart Link, quickened reflexes, adrenaline pumps, II-tier netrunner training and camouflage software.\n\nBoris Ribakov is a retired spec ops veteran, man of action and killing machine for whom there will never be a shortage of work in Dogtown.

Some people genuinely believe others are good. They trust them. They lend them money and their priced possessions. They don't think about whether they deserve it. They sacrifice their time without expecting anything in return. Briana Dolson is one such person, but only to those she considers her own - the residents of Longshore Stacks. Strangers are suspicious at best\n\nBriana rose to the top of her community in the Stacks when solving other people's problems became her daily life. Need protein blocks? You go to Briana. Child gone missing? You go to Briana. Was your brother killed? Briana. You can be sure that she'll listen to you and do everything she can to help. Of course, Briana is not a flawless. If she were, she wouldn't have ended up in Dogtown.

If you want to escape your past, you go to Night City. If the past catches up with you there, you flee to the Badlands. If you have several pasts and each of them wants you dead, then you hop over to Dogtown and pray Hansen likes you. Dodger's prayers were answered. Carl "Dodger" Robinson started working for BARGHEST and bringing in big money in the best way he knew - dealing drugs. And what about Dodger's pasts? One is the NCPD and three life sentences, another is gravely insulting a prominent Tyger Claws boss, and the third is a group of nomads robbed of several million eddies. Everyone knows, however, that Hansen's people can't be touched. Not in Dogtown.

The world isn't fair. Those who hold power abuse it; the law favors the rich; the poor get poorer; the rich get richer and so on. While you're busy arguing whether that's a cynical or objective view of the world, NCPD officer Charles Wilson is stopping cars in Watson and extorting bribes. This is a man who has learned that life rewards those who take shortcuts - a piece of knowledge he uses on a daily basis.

Fiona Vargas is extremely talented and moderately cynical, at least by Dogtown standards. She quickly became a respected ripper in the community, and just as quickly she was faced with a choice - either stay at the hospital and treat patients, or start cybermodifying athletes. Help people, or make money. After a few years, she became the head of the Center for Neuromotor Development, Site 341, and her office accumulated medals, trophies and awards won by the outstanding athletes she helped mould.\n\nThere is, however, no success without failure. Some kids don't succeed and their files end up in a drawer in Fiona's desk - and there they stay, buried along with their dreams. Today, Dr. Fiona Vargas' main job is to divide people into two types - those who will bring her medals, and those who belong in the drawer.

A prosecutor with fifteen years of experience under her belt and the bane of gangers from Northside all the way to Pacifica. She has established her reputation on a ruthless adherence to one simple rule: there is no escaping justice. The media love her because she always has a juicy statement and her superiors give her promotion after promotion as her conviction rate shoots through the roof.\n\nYet some claim there's more to Georgina than meets the eye - namely her shady dealings with the underworld and her selective understanding of justice. Whenever the law doesn't suit her aims, she bends it. To get what you want in Night City, sometimes you have to strike a deal with the devil. Georgina has him on speed-dial.

A Zetatech engineer who thought he had caught his big break after landing a corporate position, though in reality it turned out to be Zetatech who ha caught him by the balls. His knack for problem-solving made him a competent engineer and an even better grifter. His intelligence, diluted by clumsiness, means he usually has more luck than sense, but by some miracle he always lands on his feet.

Born in Leningrad in 2034, she was recruited by SovOil agents while studying at the Leningrad Sanitary-Hygiene Medical Institute, with a specialization in anesthetics. According to a character profile drawn up by the SovOil Security Bureau, she is "a cunning, intelligent and shrewd individual with no interest in ideological matters, fond of money and her profession."\n\nIt is hard to argue with this assessment. For years, Katya followed orders to the letter, deploying her knowledge during interrogations, making sure her interlocutors' conditions didn't reach critical levels too soon, listening and analyzing every word they uttered. She has an excellent memory and the things she hears can prove very valuable - and not only to her employers.

If insecurity is the fuel for pathological ambition and toxic relationships, then Leon Rinder drove his entire life on a full tank. Dysfunctional families and rough upbringings affect some more than others, but in Rinder's case he was shaped by it. Underappreciated, unloved, inadequate. A boy raised by the streets. It was there that he began to mask his fear and bashfulness with violence and aggression. He fought and won without mercy and without any respect for human life. The streets were forced to adopt him.\n\nSometimes a guide or mentor appears on the paths of frightened, fragile men; someone who sees something in them and offers a chance at a second life. Rinder's neighborhood evidently lacked boxing coaches or charismatic preachers... instead, there was a Militech recruitment agency. Rinder was willing to sacrifice anything for the army and in turn Militech showered him with medals. The young, overly-zealous youth finally caught the attention of one Kurt Hansen. From that moment on, Rinder truly felt important.

Michael clung to various jobs, but jobs somehow never really clung to Michael. Years ago, when he landed a job repairing Militech AVs, he thought his Californian dream would finally come true. The come-down was painful: a mistake resulting in a crash, compensation for a paralyzed corpo who survived the accident, disciplinary action. Things went from bad to worse: he moved to Heywood, opened an auto repair shop and fell into bankruptcy. Then it was odd jobs here and there - cleaning megablocks and guarding parking lots with episodes of alcoholic haze in between.\n\nWhen his wife finally decided she'd had enough, took their son and left, Michael decided to start fresh. He scammed a friend out of a loan, fled to Dogtown and opened a slot machine parlor. This time things will work out... right?

A member of the Crimson Harvest terrorist organization since 2074. She and her four siblings spent her childhood on her family's corn farm in Indiana.

After the farm went bankrupt and Nele's parents were forced to sell their land to Biotechnica, Springer moved to Night City. A moderate payout from a compensation fund for the children of relocated farmers enabled her to study chemistry. The university, as it turned out, was a breeding ground for revolutionary initiatives - and excellent hunting ground for recruiters of various dubious organizations.

When the Crimson Harvest offered Nele to join its ranks, she didn't hesitate for a second. Yet she never stopped feeling like a stranger in the mega city - and although she was a brilliant student, she was tormented by the thought her degree was bought with her parents' blood. Sabotaging Biotechnica seemed the perfect way of alleviating her remorse. Then reality caught up to her.

As a member of the scavs in Dogtown, her comrades hold her in high regard. Why? Unlike them, she has something she really cares about – family.

Despite Nika and Gaspar being twins, she takes care of her brother like a caring older sister. When Gaspar became addicted to immunosuppressants, Nika blamed herself. Before she could force him to go into rehab, he vanished in Dogtown.

One last lead pointed Nika to Anthony Anderson's clinic on Montaña de Oro Ave.

Formerly a Catholic priest, now a "spiritual advisor" to patients at the Haven clinic in Dogtown. An idealist, but also a man who isn't afraid to face the truth - when the pews at his congregation began gathering dust, he chose to act. Instead of closing the church's doors to "unbelievers", i.e. Dogtown newcomers looking for a roof over their heads, Odell opened them even wider.\n\nWith the help of Anthony Anderson, a surgeon with a mysterious past, they set up a clinic for the most needy, poorest residents. If constant exposure to the clinic's hopelessness hasn't led Odell to a crisis of faith, it either means he never truly believed in God, or that he's a saint.

When Stella was a little girl, she dreamed of becoming a rock star. When she grew up, she tried to get hired at Militech. When she realized that pursuing dreams is the stuff of BDs, she became a police officer. Every day she risks her life to help those who don't appreciate it and gets in the way of people who have a good memory for faces. She re-ups her cortisol blockers once every two months and would do it more often were it not for her NCPD paycheck just about covering her rent.\nShe met Bill at a police precinct and though it wasn't love at first sight, it gradually grew. It started with sharing rent, followed by the impossible: vacations, a bigger apartment and corporate health care. Eventually Bill proposed and Stella accepted, though not at first. She still owns a large collection of braindances.

Steven Santos is a patriot willing to sacrifice much for his country. Perhaps not his life, but at the very least his self-respect. As a risk assessment specialist in Brazil's intelligence service, he not only knows when a mission is in jeopardy, but when to look the other way and keep things under wraps. What more could you want from a loyal subordinate?\n\nSantos faces any distasteful or righteous decisions with reluctance and well-known cliches like "If I don't do it, someone else will", or "That's just how the system works." But when Santos' conscience gets too murky, he makes an effort to clean it up. Just not too clean.

When Tommie sat in his room filled with posters of famous athletes, he was just another kid living in a west coast slum. When he got into the Center for Neuromotor Development in Dogtown, he was convinced he'd finally made it big.\n\nWithin a day, dreams of a sports career turned into an achievable goal. And so began the daily examinations, painful trials, surgeries and buckets of sweat poured into training. Tommie felt special. Important. But he wasn't the only child at Fiona Vargas's center, and it soon became apparent there were more talented kids than him. Tommie saw the peak, only he'd never reach the top.

The name of this assassin-for-hire who works for the Cuban cartel has become synonymous with bad news. It is said that every time someone in Havana lights a cigar, Aguilar extinguishes a life somewhere around the globe... all to secure the interests of her employers. In the criminal underworld, she has developed the reputation of the ultimate assassin: ruthless, incorruptible and brutally efficient. Sometimes she also acts as a negotiator, where even her mere presence can cool heated disputes. But should the one-woman diplomatic corps routine fail, bodies will begin to drop. As many as necessary.\n\nHer legend has grown to the point that some Valentinos scare their misbehaving children with the warning: "If you don't quiet yourself, Aguilar will." Even if you only believe a fraction of the urban legends tied to her, the infamous assassin would still have dozens of high-profile victims to her name. Whether you're a gang leader, police commissioner, corp exec or politician, when you hear the name Aguilar, you run, you hide and you pray for mercy.

Undercover FIA agent, metanthropic technology specialist and Solomon Reed's ex-protégé. Growing up in the slums of the Los Angeles Metroplex, she saw her parents drown in various addictions, her friends' childhoods plummet into a neverending cycle of crime, an environment riddled with inescapable poverty and a life of hopelessness... but she always dreamed of seeing herself on the braindance billboards. It was a stroke of luck that the BD studio that discovered her was an FIA front.\nSoon, Alex was a fledgling agent under the wing of accomplished spy Solomon Reed, undertaking risky ops and classified missions - both domestic and foreign. When the Unification War broke out, she was sent to Night City, where things went south and Alex came full circle. She returned to the slums she so desperately wanted to leave, though this time it was Dogtown instead of LA. After seven years under cover doing routine spy work, she had almost lost hope of ever getting out of this hellhole... until an old friend suddenly appeared on her doorstep.

The more fiery half of the of the netrunner duo that go by the name of Skylight in cyberspace. Relatively wealthy by birth, formally educated, but perpetually insatiable, she craves adventure, excitement and unusual experiences, which first pushed her to work - then lock horns - with the French criminal organization known as the Collective. Along the way, there was some time done in the VIP wing of "La Santé" prison, work for Militech on the Cynosure project and, of course, the numerous hacking assignments she undertook with her twin brother on the side. Today, however, she's entertaining Kurt Hansen himself. And tomorrow? Maybe one of the fashion shows she so loves to attend? A visit to Tokyo, London, Paris? Or maybe another dangerous assignment for dangerous peeps? Who knows what tomorrow will bring...

The more phlegmatic half of the netrunner duo known as Skylight in cyberspace. An avid meditator, expensive car lover and preacher of what he calls "spiritual hygiene," but also a formally educated software engineer. He offered his services honestly and legally for a time, but very quickly realized that he would rather hack for organized crime and clandestine corporate operations rather than be just another quant for a European agency. The Cynosure project, part of Militech's Night City operations, was one of many assignments Aymeric was involved in, rarely working without his twin sister by his side. He recently returned to the City of Dreams at the personal invitation of Kurt Hansen. If you wanna do biz, do it with the big fish; the bigger, the better.

A heap of muscle and chrome bearing the rank of Lieutenant Colonel in BARGHEST. Bennett was Kurt Hansen's sidekick from the days when they both served in the army, where he stood out for his strength and determination on the battlefield, but also for his lack of discipline and sadism. He avoided jail time for his war crimes only because of Hansen's intervention - and only to him is Bennett unswervingly loyal. When the ashes of war settled over Pacifica in 2070, Bennett emerged as commander of the armed forces of the freshly-formed BARGHEST. He continues in that role to this day, inspiring respect mixed with fear among his subordinates. Obedient to Hansen, he never crosses the line without an explicit order, but his favorite pastime remains hanging people from lampposts.

A media for whom, until recently, writing for screamsheets was her bread and butter. But Bree always wanted something more from life. She finally stumbled across a serious story, and although it got red-hot, she decided not to let it go. Now she's rummaging through corp closets for skeletons - a lucrative commodity in Night City that could either earn you stacks, or more commonly a bullet to the head.\nBree is paranoid and stressed, but that's hardly surprising given the circumstances. She knows what she wants and intends to achieve it regardless of the price. She is secretive and careful with her words - saving them instead for her articles.

Personal bodyguard to Jago, member of BARGHEST and a man with an obscure past. On the surface, Charlie (as he's known to friends) appears to be the task-oriented type, a man of few words. Because of this, many assume his mental capacities have been dulled by years of excessive cyberware use, though this couldn't be farther from the truth.

Charlie has a passion for chess and German opera. Only a select few know that he spent his childhood on the streets of Vienna, dreaming of a career on the stage. However, his family's sudden bankruptcy forced him into a life of crime, eventually leading him to Dogtown.

Today, Charlie is one of Jago's most capable and trusted soldiers. Without him, Jago may have never climbed so high in his career.

Militech's undercover agent, a cyber-cowboy who hunts down individuals who threaten the corporation's interests, often operating under cover. Beneath the face of a cool professional is a man who simply wants to do the right thing. Dante knows it's easy to make a mistake when passing judgment alone, but he also knows it's safer to shoot one time too many than one time too few. He only manages to sleep soundly once the job is done. He doesn't particularly enjoy working for Militech, but every day he gets up, swallows the bitter pill and fits his iron in his holster; he knows that if he lets go, the world - his world - would probably collapse.

If BARGHEST was a legitimate corporation, Jago would be its CFO and his name would be on platinum-coated business cards. For now, he has to settle for the unofficial position of the organization's "treasurer". He's a real numbers whisperer, a virtuoso accountant and the bane of stubborn contractors. Though he may seem the odd one out in a highly-militarized structure, Jago aims high and works diligently to achieve his goals. His friendly disposition is only a facade, behind which lies a cold, calculating intellect.

Hansen's lieutenant and close comrade from the days of "Midnight Storm" - the operation to occupy Pacifica. Normally a loyal soldier, his reputation has recently taken a hit - he messed up big-time, started making deals behind Kurt's back... Subtlety is not his strong suit - he'd rather shoot all his problems than fix them.\n\nAfter years of serving under Hansen, he's getting increasingly annoyed with being treated as an inferior. Either he proves himself through loyalty and resourcefulness... or through shrewdness and wile. As a gambling man, he couldn't choose anything but the latter.

Most of the files on Kurt Hansen's military past were classifed as top secret following the end of the Unification War. Only top Militech execs and certain members of Congress in Washington have clearance to learn just who this former Colonel truly is. He's the man who secured a foothold for the NUSA in Night City as part of Operation "Midnight Storm". The same man who then, after being abanonded by the NUS government at war's end, built from that foothold a new homeland for himself, all financed by smuggling and arms deals on a global scale.

To some, he's a glorified gangster and war profiteer, to others – a deserter and terrorist. To others still, he's the charismatic leader of BARGHEST, the liberating force that keeps Dogtown free from NCPD jurisdiction and corporate influence and that has turned the derelict district into a new home for so many without one.

Kurt Hansen is a man of many faces. But if you ask Dogtown residents, most will say it's safer to keep your head down than to see any of them for yourself.

Two batshit-crazy twins going on even crazier adventures - the duo Night City viewers deserved, but didn't know they needed. The two sisters' show brings content that would perk up even the most skullsponge-fried BD zombie, with weekly episodes packed to the brim with adrenaline and sheer absurdity.

The one and only Queen Bitch of Dogtown! An aspiring BD star who would pounce at the first chance of making it big. And if someone stands in her way of glory, she'll claw their face off. For now, her BDs are mainly circulating amongst the truly desperate BD junkies of Dogtown, but everyone starts somewhere, right? After all, difficult starts only make for extra drama in one's biography.

For the longest time, Murphy thought the most important thing was to find himself in the right place at the right time at least once - then life would be a breeze. Years spent living in Dogtown shattered this illusion. You had to stick with the right people, often break your back for them. Dogtown is a miniscule nation, but its atmosphere is tense - it needs an iron fist to keep the comers and goers in check. That fist belongs to Murphy. As a representative of Hansen's more approachable side, he'll talk to everyone who's anyone and sound them out. Depending on the need, or Hansen's mood, that talk can go smoothly, or it can end with a bullet in the other person's skull.

The incumbent president of the New United States of America. Myers was born into a wealthy and influential East Coast family, said to be descendants of the first English settlers aboard the Mayflower. She began her political career in the US Marine Corps - her patriotism, courage on the battlefield, obedience and discipline paved the way for her rapid promotion and brought her to the attention of Militech's top brass. After the death of the corporation's CEO, Donald Lundee, it was Myers who succeeded him.

There are conflicting opinions about Myers' reign as president of the corporation, but her reformist zeal has earned her more opponents than supporters. Without waiting for an official vote of no confidence, Myers tendered her honorary resignation as CEO, justifying the decision with her intention to run for the office of the president of NUSA. She won the election, becoming the second - in the brief history of the New States - woman in the Oval Office.

She ended her first term with a bang with the Unification War in 2069 to reunite all the states. Despite military support from Militech, Myers had to withdraw NUSA troops from California. Her shattered expansionist dreams apparently didn't deter Myers in the slightest, nor have they damaged her popularity as she went on to win two subsequent elections and is now gearing up for a fourth term.

Although as a politician Myers appears in her element, those close to her know she misses her time in the marines. That's not to say the NUSA president's life is devoid of excitement - repeated assassination attempts confirm that a dead Myers would be more valuable to some political factions than the status quo. Yet for the time being, the greatest danger to the president's life remains her long-standing nicotine addiction.

Solomon Reed is a sleeper agent of the Federal Intelligence Agency (FIA) and among the best agents in the NUSA's ranks. In his heyday, Reed could compete with legends like Morgan Blackhand, but he was never interested in being a one-time star and collecting medals on his shelf. People like Reed look for something greater than themselves, and he found it by serving his country, no matter how dirty the work.\n\nHis dossier includes thwarted assassination attempts on important figures and successful negotiations with kidnappers, but also blackmail, sabotage operations and coups in South American republics. His last mission: to build a network of spies in Night City during the Unification War. In 2070, when the conflict became a lost cause for the NUSA, Reed's cell was disbanded and he dropped off the radar. Though he no longer reads the morning report with his breakfast, for seven years he has been waiting for a one particular phone call - a call that just came in.

A brilliant Voodoo Boy netrunner who was once the right hand of Maman Brigitte before they clashed over ideals. Brigitte dreamed of piercing the Blackwall, which led to constant skirmishes with NetWatch, while Slider preferred to stay away from grand schemes to focus on what he did best - carrying out corporate heists and assassinations via cyberspace. Unfortunately for him, one such heist caught the attention of FIA agents, who irreversibly deprived him of his sight, and then through blackmail and intimidation made him their informant. In an attempt to break free from the agency's chains, he fled Pacifica and joined his brothers in Dogtown, where he took control of an illegal software operation. As it turned out, the FIA's reach extended there as well.

Song So Mi (Korean -  송소미), codenamed "Songbird", is a netrunner in the FIA. She started out as a freelance netrunner, taking on assignments that others dismissed as well-paying but suicidal. Meanwhile, before So Mi's eyes, corporate data fortresses opened without so much as a shove. She always worked solo and spent every eddie earned on newer, better equipment and ever-more-extravagant means of entertainment. She quickly became a living legend of the trade, although some didn't believe someone of her caliber could exist for long - if at all. The FIA believed.

When Song took an oath of allegiance to the New United States and was given the operational nickname "Songbird," the prototype technologies developed by the agency in strict secrecy from foreign governments - and sometimes from her own - were placed at her fingretips. In return, Songbird was forced to quickly learn two concepts that had been completely foreign to her until that point: following orders and playing as a team.

The immunity of a government agent, backed and protected by a powerful bureaucratic apparatus, guaranteed Song would remain untouchable. From masking vehicle signatures at secret meetings between NUSA officials and military juntas in Central America, to obliterating the digital footprints of commandos that executed terrorists impersonating the Bartmoss collective, NetWatch agents could only listen to the echoes of Songbird's footsteps in cyberspace - echoes that suspiciously went quiet near the Blackwall.

Fiona,
You're cordially invited to the town of Qala on the Maltese island of Gozo. It would be an enormous honor if you would find the time to pay us a visit and share your thoughts on the site we have built here. We would like to be up and running by next year and are currently scouting athletes who might join us.

You know how much I value your opinion and experience and I'm prepared to compensate you for it as well. No need to worry about the heat - we'll make sure you're as comfortable as possible.

Best regards,
Bertu
:(  well…aint u the disappointment that keeps on givin

Know what you're thinkin' – all is lost, right? Could be true in some way, I guess. But it's just as true that you get to live on.\nDunno, somebody out there might be lookin' out for you to come back. Start callin' – friends, acquaintances, associates, even. Then get back to NC. You'll build a new life for yourself, one with new meaning, I know you will. Or you'll find some traces of your old life and purpose.\nAnd if none of that pans out, set out and see what's beyond the horizon. 'Cause there's always somethin' there, V. Always.

Dear Dr. Vargas,
We need your help. Our daughter Jennifer Haley spent three years of her life in your facility, but unfortunately was never chosen for a contract. I make no secret of the fact that our family's financial situation doesn't permit us to cover the costs of Jennifer's medication.

As you're well aware, without her medication, the modifications you've given her will cause her to suffer. A sixteen-year-old girl shouldn't have to experience cluster headaches or kidney stones.

I'm begging for your help. I'm not asking for money - only for medication to stop my daughter from being in pain.

Sincerely,
Peter Haley
---------------------------
From: Dr. Thomas Harper
To: Peter Haley
RE: Jennifer Haley - help needed

Dear Mr. Haley,
I'm an assistant to Dr. Vargas and I'm answering on her behalf. I'd like to remind you that the parents of every child who enrolls in our program is informed of the potential health risks that may arise from our cybermodifications.

Both you and your wife signed an agreement in which you waived the right to file any financial claims in connection with your child's potential health issues in exchange for free room and board, training and modification for your child for (as you yourself pointed out) a three-year duration. The possibilities and associated risks were known to you.

I wish you and your child health and prosperity, and ask that you please stop harassing our esteemed Dr. Fiona Vargas, or we will be forced to take legal action.

Sincerely,
Thomas Harper
Assistant to Dr. Fiona Vargas
---------------------------
From: Peter Haley
To: Dr. Fiona Vargas
RE: Jennifer Haley - help needed

YOU MOTHERFUCKERS! FUCK YOU! FUCK YOU! FUCK YOUUUU!!!!!!
There's that, plus someone kinda misses you... ;)
Can you answer please? Even one word? Got me worryin
Still can't top you 'n' me as a wrecking crew ;)
Fuck, you ok? Pick up dammit
Or… maybe you're working a big gig right now?
I'm trying to call, can you please answer?
Everything is ready, we must meet Hanako-sama, that is all
I can wait no more. I will go alone
This is not like you, V. I hope you get this message
Dear Tenant, please settle past-due rent amounts within the next 3 days. Failure to do so may result in legal action being taken against you.
Just do me a favor and let me know you're alive, all right?
It'll help this old man sleep at night.
A rabble of doubting Thomases have come to the conclusion that I am too old for Heywood. I seek trusted people who could convince the heathens they are gravely mistaken.
Can I count on your support?
If you do not respond, I can only assume your journey has come to its end.
Hey, something big came up. I'm gonna call again and I need you to answer.
V, I'm flat serious. This is a conversation for the holo or face to face. I can't spell it out in writing.
Jesus christ, so be it. We're leaving NC. The family, I mean, and I don't know what to do. I need your perspective here.
I need you to tell me straight – do you want me to stay? If so, then that settles it. I just have to know what that means exactly. What will come of that choice…
Look… I'm sorry. My temper got the better of me.
Just please tell me you're alive.

When are you gonna send someone to pick up this bot? It needs to be gone before someone figures out I'm stashing it. I need to keep it connected to the subnet - if I disconnect it, it'll cut the power and lock the interface so tight not even a genius netrunner could breach. Feel me? As if that wasn't enough, the interface dumps neural data from last client to use it into the subnet - folks are starting to complain. So get your asses into gear.
-------------------
From: Oscar Garcia
To: Lucas Clarke
RE: Bot

Relax, you got your scratch, so just sit tight. If you didn't hide the bot like a gonk, what's there to worry about? Anyone asks, just play dumb.

Our guy'll drop by at the facility within 3 days, I'll drop a sig later about when exactly. Once he's there, you haul the bot out come nighttime, we'll finally have access to some fancy new tech and you'll get your second payment.
Blast radius comparable to three anti-personnel mines

Katya, there’s a rumor going around the stadium that SovOil is hunting someone in Dtown... get in touch as soon as you can. Leaving you the package here like we agreed, plus I added a little something extra. Ping me soon, we’ll think of something.\nJerry

Tuesday: pack the merch (boxes labeled XCH-230 and XCH-234), move it to Rancho Coronado and return with Mark’s reagents

Wednesday: off

Thursday: Kabuki gear arrives, gotta snake it into DT

Friday: move dope from Stacks to downtown NC

Attention flea bags!\nSome of you may have served alongside me at Militech. Others survived Midnight Storm by my side, and others yet made it through other stormy days with me. But today, we all stand as equals in mourning the loss of colonel Kurt Hansen. Though this is a sad day for everyone who knew and served under him, you need not worry – Hansen may be dead, but BARGHEST is very much alive! I hereby solemnly swear we will find the sons of bitches who killed our leader. I also promise to be a prudent interim commander and promptly step down on the day we designate a new commander in chief.\nSigned: Lt Col Chester Bennett

A King of Cups is a creative and emotionally-driven person. They are a strong individual, who realizes the importance of feelings. Intuition helps them navigate their lives. When fate falls in their favor, compassion guides their actions. When they're at odds with fate, it can be unwise to trust them.

The King of Pentacles is imperious. They represent enterprise, pragmatism, but also attachment. From such a person one can expect coldness or attachment to material possessions; they are likely to turn your world upside down sooner or later.

Two things matter above all else for a King of Swords: logic and conviction. They represent a person with a precise moral compass, who is known for their caring demeanor. However, enemies beware - the King of Swords is a ruthless opponent, who will not rest until you are punished and left to be torn apart by hounds of fate.

The master of planning and unorthodox ideas. An individual who brings people together and radiates inspiration to those they consider friends. However, their enemies will soon find they are an impulsive, devastating force of nature, capable of breaking oaths and crossing any line, just to see their goals achieved.

To all NCPD Pacifica staff,

Effective October 17, 2072, the NCPD Pacifica precinct is hereby disbanded and the contracts of all officers working therein are terminated. We suggest you leave the precinct in civilian attire in view of strong anti-police sentiments in the area. We have also received reports of planned riots in Pacifica, including a potential attack on the precinct itself, which is why we advise you to leave the building ASAP. The decision to disband the precinct has the full backing of mayor Lucius Rhyne.

Respectfully,
Claudia Feldman
NCPD Deputy Commissioner

Well, you've gone and got her. The netrunner-agent-friend-traitor-chick who bet on herself, fought against all odds and lost it all... Who was Songbird, really? Who was she to you? I think I already know the answer. You were never helping her out of the goodness of your heart, were you? Fuck, I just hope... Never mind. In a second you'll hand her body over to Myers. That'll be the end for you, for Reed. Only question remaining is when shit'll complicate itself again. Because trust me, it will.

You're hot on the heels of a girl who's got nothing left to lose. Nothing can make a person more dangerous, but you probably already know that. Reed thinks he can still save her. Is he lying to himself on purpose? Or maybe he knows his old friend too well? What do you think? Who'll you find once you finally reach her? I've got a feeling even So Mi doesn't know the answer to that...

Not lookin' good, V. Alex is dead, Songbird's been nabbed by MaxTac and Reed… well, Reed still thinks he's got everything under control. But isn't this whole rescue op proof that he's lost the thread? I'll give him one thing - come hell or high water, he doesn't give up - keeps pushing forward till he gets his way. The key to success, you think? Guess we'll find out... long as we don't end up tossed into Los Padres first.

A message from Reed… A welcome surprise or a reason to nibble my nails raw? He wants to meet at the place where it all kicked off – symbolism's fucking plain as day. Problem with symbols is that they can mean a shitload of different things. 'Specially when it's an FIA agent extending the invitation.

Popular in Dogtown, “phant” is a highly addictive hallucinogenic drug that affects the central nervous system and causes irreversible changes in the brain. It stimulates the production of both serotonin and dopamine. Delusions and hallucinations involving all the senses (sight, hearing, touch) appear soon after the drug is consumed – hence the rumors that the drug is stronger than even the best braindances. Interestingly, the environment surrounding the person consuming the drug has a direct influence on the course of the hallucination. In Dogtown, one may already find designated “trip tellers” who lead “phant” addicts through their “experiences” and thus create their so-called trips for them. The effect is similar to that of "Deep Dive," though the latter is far less addictive and has a much weaker effect on the senses. "Phant" causes hallucinations and altered states of consciousness that are far more intense (according to patient descriptions, around two to four times stronger). My statistics indicate that 86 percent of those who try "deep dive" later move on to "phant," making the former something of a gateway drug.\n\nWhen the effects of "phant" subside, severe irritability, anxiety and insomnia are known to occur. With time, those addicted to the drug complain of difficulty concentrating and assimilating new information as well as memory issues, which is a direct result of interneuron damage. “Phant” causes neuronal death after only the first use and can cause personality changes in the user. A full chemical analysis indicates that the drug has been formulated to circumvent the blockers present in the most popular liver and kidney boosters as well as brain-protecting cyberware.

Lorraine, listen, I’m trying to get to the bottom of this phant stuff. How it works, what the mechanism of addiction is. Could you send me the soft for those new Arasaka liver boosters?

---------------
From: Lorraine Parks
To: Maggie Isley
RE: how phant works

Chapter 2: Present day

According to the 2075 census, Tycho's residents number 40,000 and is one of Luna's two thriving cities (the other being Copernicus with a population of approx. 18,000). The transport of minerals from Tycho to Earth as well as Crystal Palace is possible thanks to Mass Drivers (two on Tycho, one on Copernicus). In 2008 during the six-hour-long First Orbital War, a moon rock weighing two tons crashed into Colorado Springs, launched from a Mass Driver on Tycho. Casualties included the majority of the US Armed Forces command, bringing an immediate end to the conflict.

If you receive this message, I beg you please deliver it to the nearest human rights organization. My name is Mateusz Kowalczyk and I am in a work camp near Warsaw in the Polish People's Republic. I am a prisoner here for 12 years. I work fifteen hours a day with no free days. I weigh 62 kg and am 183 cm tall. If we do not meet daily weapon production quotas we are tortured. We pack the weapons into crates that are then sent out into the world. I do not know where are we exactly, I do not know what month it is, my loved ones think I am dead. I beg you, please help us. Please. We make weapons for Arasaka. I do not know how this is possible, but we do. The Polish People's Republic has always been controlled by the USSR, which does not allow Arasaka factories in Poland, at least not officially. I am 53 years old. They imprisoned me because I had books from NUSA. I think the factory is somewhere near Ząbki. Please, please someone take pity on me.

Once upon a time there was Daniel, who wanted to make some easy money and helped flood the NC market with fake Zetatech KLW-8193818 implants. Daniel thought he could oversee this little operation and nobody from Zetatech would find him. Daniel was mistaken. Now, Daniel has two options.\n1 – Ignore this message, in which case, however banal it may sound, he will meet a fate that will end his story for good\n2 – Daniel can take this message seriously and ensure that any fake KLW-8193818s stay on his side of the wall, in Dogtown. How this adventure ends, only Daniel can decide. We would also like to stress that Daniel cannot somehow get away with what he's done. There is no option 3; any attempts to run are considered option 1.

A series of lectures on medical developments
The bones of a T-Rex with… cancer!

The bones of a Tyrannosaurus Rex that was under study by researchers at NCU has finally returned home! As it turns out, the abnormal growth at the base of the femur is a symptom of  bone cancer - the latest specimen proving that dinosaurs also suffered from the deadly disease.\nThe pain caused by the illness would have led to consequences that may have spelled the untimely demise of our reptilian guest.

Registration will soon open for a series of lectures run by professors of medicine at NCU as well as specialists in augmentation from leading medical corporations. The talks will focus on cutting-edge solutions and trailblazing methods working to support the human body's regeneration, as well as the risks and issues that the field has been struggling with for years.\nThe program will take a fluid format, adapting to current changes in the market and tackling the most topical matters of the day. We'll keep our fingers on the pulse - together! Register using the form to receive information about each lecture along with your reservation link. Spaces for each talk are limited, so don't wait!

Did someone say "raffle"?! You heard right! Out of all the guests who visited us this month, we'll be drawing ten lucky winners who'll each receive their very own potted Auracaria! Until then, come check it out! Learn about the conditions in which this ancient plant first grew during the Mesozoic era and how it's survived until today!

Stronger, faster, better!
Welcome to the temple of chrome! Discover the latest marvels in cyberware! Witness mankind ruthlessly reaching beyond the limits of the human body! Want to see the newest bionic lungs in action? Understand how mnemonic enhancers work? Or maybe you're wondering if the latest rocket launcher models pack enough bang for their buck?
At the Digimmortal: Cyberware Technology exhibition, you'll be in awe of not only the latest solutions to society's technological needs, but also see them operate firsthand. Each of our exhibits simulate the real-life circumstances of an implant's use and is divided in different stages. That which cannot be observed with the naked eye can be viewed using our holographic interface.
Keep up with mankind - we'll show you where it's heading.

The sky is not the limit - at the ESC Explorer Exhibit, the only limit is your imagination!\nEver find yourself daydreaming of space travel? Kids at home always asking "When will you take us into orbit?" With ESC Explorer, you're closer than ever! Here you'll see a real-life space shuttle from up close, discover all you need to know about travelling in one and what to expect! You'll put on a real space suit and enter a low-gravity enironmented comparable to that of the moon, as well as get the chance to chat with our department representatives. Our employees will be thrilled to tell you all about living in space and the challenges and adventures that await mankind!

Take a stroll through the hot, humid wilderness of a prehistoric jungle where you might come face to face with fearsome predators!\nImmerse yourself in overgrown thickets, meet the stare of a chameleon (if you can find it!), marvel at the fossils of Earth's former rules dating back millions of years! Keep up with the latest Organitopia has to offer, from lectures, temporary exhibits, events and curators' tours - all at the tip of your fingers!\nForget about expensive vacations that are over as soon as they've begun. Come down to Organitopia and experience a completely different world!

What secrets does the human body hold? Uncover how mankind became master of his mortal coil and tapped into its full potential. Here at Anatomicon, you'll learn about what led humanity to perfect the human form, the methods that evolved with our ever-expanding passion until the present day and also what mysterious remain unsolved!\nWill we ever unlock the secret to immortality? How does nature respond to our ambitions with its pre-programmed limits? Are there limits at all? Let's find out together!

The stadium is the beating heart of Dogtown, and the Tunnel is one of its main arteries. This is where BARGHEST smuggles illegal weapons and tech into Night City.\n\nImagine you're a corp CEO – you need to equip a gang to do some dirty work for you, and you need it done quietly. You go to the stadium in Dogtown, choose a supplier, pay up front, then let Hansen's people take care of the rest. Within 48 hours, 6th Street will have their hands on those sixty Militech M251s Ajax rifles you ordered.

One of the most distinctive examples of Brutalist architecture in the never-quite-finished district of Pacifica. Today it is an important landmark for Dogtown residents and serves as a den for a local cluster of Voodoo Boys. It is here that illegal programs, daemons and hacks are made then sent of to be sold under the counter in Kabuki. This is where the real tech wizards weave their magic. Overclocked decks, processors with stripped-down safety features, bootleg drivers – these things and more are made in batches by Slider and his crew. There's a strong chance that the hacks bought and sold in the netrunner networks of the Kabuki Roundabout were born right here in the heart of Luxor Heights within the concrete skeleton of Eventide Resort & Spa.

The NCPD exists to serve and protect one thing – statistics. The fewer the murders and assaults, the higher their praise from the mayor. The higher the praise, the fatter their bonuses.

NCPD officers like to close the book on most cases as quickly as possible. They come across a dead body in a dark alley with multiple gunshot wounds to the head and torso, they call it a suicide. People die violent deaths in Night City every day, but rarely will the police classify these as "murder".

The statistics at the NCPD station in Pacifica painted too grim (read: realistic) a picture, so the city shuttered it overnight. Today, the station serves those who never made it into official police statistics, but who are certainly more than deserving.

The avant-garde exterior of Luxor High Wellness Spa brings to mind the monumental feats of the ancient world such as the now-demolished Temple of Hatshepsut and the mysterious ziggurats of Mesopotamia. It was designed by prominent architect Dionizy Haponik (born 09-11-2021 in Warsaw, Poland) who was known to draw heavy inspiration from sacral architecture.\n\nUnfinished since the 2050s, the building was to become a modern temple for beauty and spiritual bliss, where wealthy Pacifica residents and visitors could indulge in expensive rituals to prolong their lives. Never mind the fact their synthetic skin, titanium bones and genetically boosted metabolisms were already doing a solid job of that. This place was designed to be the very definition of luxury – prohibitively expensive and wholly unnecessary.

The Center for Neuromotor Development Site 341 is a cutting-edge facility dedicated to the development of young athletes. Its main goal is to discover young talent and shepherd them into successful careers. Prospective athletes spend years under the guidance of specialists – ripperdocs, coaches, biohackers and psychologists. These young athletes undergo genetic and cybernetic modification to ensure their nervous systems are capable of high performance from an early age.\n\nHowever, not all bodies can withstand the demands of modern-day competitive sports, whose spectacle lies partially in taking risks and pushing the limits of human capability. As the "341" in its name would imply, there are hundreds of such facilities across the world. Not all operate in accordance with the law.

Rumor has it that Militech bought as many bottles of champagne for the this exhibition's opening as there were liters of concrete already poured into the district's construction. The unending flow of bubbly, the self-aggrandizing applause and the lofty promises delivered during the ceremony were intended to inflate egos and encourage the city's elite to open their wallets for the next stages of development. The guest list included everyone who wielded influence in the city and the bank account to back it up.

Alas, although the grand opening was meant to last a couple of days, it never came to pass. This exhibit-turned-mausoleum of grand ideas and ambitions continues to rot in Dogtown to this day, a mockery and reminder of the past's utopian plans for the future. Nothing remains of the weapon displays and special security systems. Everything that wasn't nailed to the floor (and even the things that were) have long since been removed and are likely repurposed in such mundane ways it would cause the expo's original designers to shed a tear.

Today, Colonel Hansen and his comrades like to receive prominent guests here. After all, what better way to kick off an potential business venture than by spinning a tale of abandoned citizens taking the future into their own hands.

A temple for technology located in the Terra Cognita technology park that was built to showcase the latest innovations produced by the world's leading tech manufacturers. The exhibits here were designed to be an interactive, hands-on experience to raise awareness for cyberware's potential as well as boost healthy competition between producers.\n\nToday, the pavilion is infested with scavs who tirelessly pick apart the exhibit, like vultures on a carcass, as part of their illegal trade of cybernetic components.

Follwing my discreet investigation into the hospital where Kurt Hansen was treated, I found the names of only two people in the patient's record who visited him before his expiration: Lt. Col. Bennett and Jago Szabó. Due to the patient's inability to communicate, both visits were kept brief and were carried out under the direct supervision of the attending physician.

However, despite not finding any irregularities in the record itself, I cannot definitively rule out the involvement of a third party. According to a member of janitorial staff, two unidentified representatives of the Arasaka Corporation had visited the hospital on the day of Kurt Hansen's death. The purpose of their visit remains unknown, but it's worth noting that a "routine surveillance system reboot" occurred while they were on hospital premises. My intuition and years of experience are telling me to pursue this lead. I'll keep you posted on any further developments.

Best regards,
Knut Taubitz
Taubitz & Associates

We must exercise extreme caution from this point on. I suspect Bennett may have had a hand in all this. I doubt he'd dirty his own hands with Hansen's blood, but I don't doubt that he'd be bold enough to dirty someone else's. I've noticed several suspicious transactions of late, from accounts he believes I'm unaware of. If my hunch is right, the real trouble is only just beginning. Bennett will stop at nothing to eliminate the competition – whether real or imaginary. We're going to need some outside support. For now, keep your heads on a swivel. It's going to get hot around here.\n\nJ.

A coin sometimes used in FIA operations. The front depicts NUS President Rosalind Myers. It's equipped with a biometrics reader and microprocessor. The moment you touched it, a profile was created and entered into an FIA database.
BARGHEST officer; right hand to Kurt Hansen

Enlisted in the NUS Marines in 2063. Twice decorated for commendable service. Thrice brought to military court on charges of insubordation (all dismissed under Col. Hansen's protective watch).

Took part in Operation Midnight Storm, but refused to demobilize after its conclusion. In 2071, officially designated a defector by Militech along with Hansen's entire unit.

He remains in Dogtown as the ex-colonel's most loyal disciple. The natural choice to succeed his throne.

Born in Budapest as Jagoda Szabó. Emigrated to Night City with his family the same year. 2066: sentenced to prison for embezzlement of Petrochem corporate funds. Released in 2068 on good behavior. Jago has since been a busy bee in Night City's underbelly.

In 2072, he helped lay the foundation of BARGHEST, and remained atop its organizational ranks due to his corporate skillset and large web of connections within the smuggling trade.

He presently seeks support for his claim to power in Dogtown from the Voodoo Boys. Last, and most certainly least, Jago is also an aficionado of purebred canines.

A talented young boxer, born and bred in Dogtown. Once part of the Animals gang, his Alpha implanted him with a chip to control him inside the ring and fix fights, reaping heaps of eddies.\n\nAaron is a demure, no-nonsense kid with a rekindled passion for boxing and in a position to seize an opportunity – an upcoming fight could change his career and let him finally break free from the gang's grip.

Cunning, witty and also the alpha of her pack in Dogtown. Unlike most Animals, she's not a hulking mountain of muscle. She earned the respect of her people through sheer charisma. It started with a simple negotiation that required a little more finesse than most Animals could muster, with both sides realizing they could benefit from mutual cooperation.\n\nSince then Angie's been on top of biz, arranging and fixing fights and wheeling in cash. She's well aware of her position and knows just how far she can reach. The right woman for the job.

A ripperdoc living in Dogtown. He left Night City after several clients accused him of undermining the performance of certain implants during standard procedures so that they would return for another visit. Trouble ensued.\n\nHe currently works for the scavs in Terra Cognita and sometimes takes jobs from Animals. Though he may seem like a decent-enough guy, he has a habit of sticking his nose where it doesn't belong, fueled by his neuroticism. Above all, he craves peace and quiet.

NEURAL NETWORK STABILIZERS MUST ALWAYS BE ONLINE!

I'm sending this message out far and wide because it's really important - THE NEURAL NETWORK STABILIZERS SHOULD ALWAYS BE ONLINE. Yesterday's incident could've been avoided if only the netrunner was connected to the stabilizers. But he wasn't. Understand this - without neural network stabilizers a netrunner's brain isn't capable of withstanding an encounter with a rogue AI. The sudden volume of data required to be processed (in the form of an attack from the AI) literally fries human synapses that are already preoccupied with the mere fact of being in cyberspace. Traditional hardware and software support is just not sufficient, which is why we created the stabilizers and why every netrunner MUST be connected to them. Granted, it decreases performance by a few percent, but at least after a deep dive the netrunner'll be able to get up from his chair on his own without foaming at the mouth and bleeding from his eyes.\nSincerely,\nTG
We need to be more careful

Manuel, the truth is that what we're doing here is illegal in every way. We have to conceal this project from the competition - that much is obvious, but more importantly so that NetWatch doesn't catch our scent. That's a little more complicated. I need the best algorithms your team's got - we have to update this ICE every few minutes. What about that permutational code you promised us? We also need a more traditional smoke screen - maybe our intelligence could incite some kind of provocation that would focus NetWatch's attention on some other parts of Night City? Or another city altogether?

Looking forward to your reply.

Claudia
---------------

From: Manuel B.
To: Claudia W.
RE: We need to be more careful

Claudia, we're doing all we can. You'll get the ICE today - we'll handle NetWatch. In the worst case we'll grease their palms to look the other way. But let's not kid ourselves - you're the ones who're holed up in that bunker trying to circus-tame artificial intelligences, any of which - if let loose - could end the world as we know it. You know that's no exaggeration. My people will try to protect you from every angle. But if some rogue AI manages to escape, we're fucking done for. Remember that.

M.

The results of our experiments are unsettling to say the least. All netrunners taking part in Project Cynosure have begun to display signs of psychological fatigue. It's possible the effects could worsen. Currently we're observing a tendency toward melancholy, increasing their introvertedness, memory loss, mild aphasia and depressive thoughts bordering on the suicidal. These symptoms are undoubtedly related to the experiments conducted as part of the project. Our professional recommendation is to put the project on hold in the interest of the netrunners' wellbeing and safety.

Prof. Alexis D.

---------------
From: Prof. Tamara G.
To: Prof. Alexis D.
RE: A few concerns

Thank you for candidly sharing your concerns with us regarding the project. As always, these insights are extremely valuable. However, taking into account the importance of this project and the imminent breakthrough we're anticipating, we unfortunately can't allow experimentation to be put on hold. If necessary, we may consider replacing the netrunners in question, though due to time concerns and the experience of our current crew, we would rather avoid that.

Nevertheless, we authorize you to make use of any substances - pharmacological or otherwise - to ensure the netrunners' readiness to continue testing.
Best of luck,
TG

Something happened to me yesterday. After a deep dive into cyberspace they whisked us away for the usual testing. At one point we got to those weird neurological tests that I always thought were kinda funny where they ask you questions that make no sense but apparently reveal something about yourself. You're probably familiar with some of them: "What is the sound of one hand clapping?", "What does a mouse running through a maze represent to you?" "What do you associate with the smell of freshly-roasted coffee?" and it was at that moment that I hesitated, because... well, I suddenly realized that I didn't know. What coffee tasted like. I know coffee IS, but that's it. Strange, right? The feeling passed when I made myself a cup of strong, black coffee, but I have to admit I was a little weirded out. What else have I potentially forgotten? Is it some kind of... side effect of my last few deep dives? I doubt it, since I've been doing them for years... Anyway, hope you're doing well, doc. Maybe the next time we meet you might have an explanation.\nLisa

I'll tell you everything during our session, but... I don't know, I just feel better writing to you about this now. I can't give any details - company secrets, NDA, yadda yadda, but... I'm locked in this place and feel like... It all started with a ringing in my ear, like a really faint whine. But then within the whine I started to hear... words? Yeah, I know, auditory hallucinations and whatnot. Classic. But at night when I'd try to fall asleep I'd get the feeling like something was trying to understand me. Something. What exactly? I don't know. I hear it in the monitors. In the cables. The walls. Whispers in the dark. Nothing that makes any sense. Heh. Do I need new meds? Fresh air? Or maybe I've finally gone cuckoo?

Sincerely,
Lisa

P.S. Thanks for agreeing to receive these messages. Please don't reply. We'll talk about everything in our session.

Everything is going according to plan. We have managed to harness the bunker's systems to establish connection with the so-called old Net. Using its own protocols and algorithms will enable us to move around within cyberspace while avoiding unwanted attention and security measures. We're testing our hypothesis of using the old Net's protocols to approach the border of the Blackwall undetected and carefully reach beyond it. If we're successful in locating and capturing one of the AIs that lies beyond, we'll try to secure it with the infrastructure located here. Of course, it will be done in such a way as to not raise suspicion within NetWatch. According to our intelligence data, the agency is still wholly unaware of our presence here.\nSincerely,\nDr. Evan McRay

I restate my request. Should we truly pass up on such an extraordinary opportunity? We are on the precipice of a breakthrough. We just need more time!
Dr. Evan McRay
---------------
From: Militech - Research Department
To: Dr. Evan McRay
RE: This is a watershed moment

Evan, we discussed this multiple times. The decision has been made. Gather your equipment and evacuate the premises. The situation is unstable as you're perfectly aware. You're not just poking the bear anymore. If we don't bury this under ground immediately, we could trigger a crisis that not even your worst nightmares could conjure up. I want to see you all in the office tomorrow. Healthy and in one piece.
Best regards,
JC
---------------
From: Dr. Evan McRay
To: Militech - Research Department
RE: This is a watershed moment

One week. That's all I ask. We'll do it - the Blackwall will understand us, communicate with us. But we need time to make sense of our communication. Just a few days - please.
---------------
From: Militech - Research Department
To: Dr. Evan McRay
RE: This is a watershed moment

Dr. McRay, you have orders. Our plans have not changed. This mission displays telltale signs of carrying too much risk. Please issue an immediate order for evacuation, or I will be forced to resort to alternate measures.
JC

Our people have succeeded in utilizing the bunker's infrastructure to approach the Blackwall and establish contact. Though we made every effort to ensure maximal security of the procedure, an incident occurred. The Blackwall (for simplicity's sake I use this term to refer to the rogue, powerful AIs of which we know very little of anyway) penetrated our security systems and using Lisa's neuro-interface attempted to take control over the core. We used standard as well as extraordinary deterrance methods, cutting off entire sections of the bunker to prevent the Blackwall from accessing our mainframe. The situation is currently under control and Lisa has been placed under specialist care.
I urge that we nevertheless proceed with the project. We have never been so close to establishing meaningful contact with the Blackwall. It is highly probable that what might appear as an attack was in fact an attempt at establishing communication. I would like to conduct a series of additional, controlled approaches to the Blackwall. I am convinced we will succeed.

Sincerely,
Dr. Evan McRay
We have arrived at the facility

We have arrived. The team is at work securing the location and our presence here has so far remained undetected.
Upon first glance, the bunker looks practically untouched. Later today we'll send our probes further into the facility to take readings from the core. Preliminary scans show that the facility is inactive and safe to conduct our research. If we manage to reach the equipment left behind and it turns out that the data gathered by the netrunners remains intact, it'll mean a breakthrough for the department. I am optimistic in that regard.
You requested that I not hesitate to include any comments unrelated to the task at hand. I applaud your keen intuition - I have the uncanny feeling that... something was waiting for us here. There's no other way to describe it. Someone's... presence embedded in the infrastructure, even though scans haven't detected any signs of life. If experiments on rogue AIs were conducted here, then maybe... their remnants are still here. Inactive. Dormant. Waiting. I'll keep you informed of our progress.

Sincerely,
Dr. Evan McRay

I once read about the impossiblity of reaching the Absolute. Philosophers have tried to define it, prove its existence or lack thereof. But what if what we're trying to do here is exactly that - establishing contact with the Absolute? Every time they drop us into the deep Net, I feel as if I'm nearing something intangible, something that defies reason, lies beyond human understanding. I am a netrunner. Specialization: reconnaissance and cyberspatial matrix analysis. They order us to observe all those AIs hidden in the depths of the Net. They order us to capture them. Then they want us to integrate with them. The mind of a netrunner enhanced with the ingenuity of an AI... It makes me quicker. I see more. Know more. But do I understand more? Who leads who? Who's the prophet in whose universe? My dreams... billions of luminous dots. Either stars or distant numbers. A galaxy of unfathomable meanings. Alien permutations nestled between my neurons. And I'm... I... What "I", exactly? Where exactly is my mind? Who's writing these words? Since my last dive I feel as if I'm locked in a room located somewhere in the recesses of my mind? What if these notes are only their way of testing? Probing? I am not myself anymore. I am not anymore. I am... not?

yo wanna hear the latest word on the street?

gonna be some sorta ruckus with the VDBs. heard they’re armin’ up, gettin’ ready for war. like, peeps’re sayin they got some underground factory where they’re buildin’ robots and clones and shit so they can rise up against Hansen. man I’d write it off as the usual bullshit, but I got a choom I trust sayin’ a NetWatch agent’s been hangin’ around. and choom if there’s NetWatch, there’s trouble... and maybe some truth to the talk?
Whoa, think they’re gonna march on the Black Sapphire?
Yeah but how many bots we talkin’? Pretty sure Hansen’d wipe ‘em, just goin’ by numbers alone.
who knows, choom, depends how pissed off they are

ol’ Ronnie’s seen stupider suicide ops. if you got somethin’ to prove, that means you think you’re fighting for what’s right, and ain’t that all you need? shit, for the right cause it’s worth pokin’ holes in any system. Maybe his majesty’ll at least feel somethin’ bite him in the ass?
guess we gotta wait and see. but your boy’s lookin’ out for the revolution, baby!

An abducted BD actress and a mysterious kidnapper? V to the rescue! Your usual C-flick. Just watch out, 'cause if even Hands doesn't wanna boost his street cred from this one, it must be a real stinker.

Hands' hunch didn't disappoint. This gig's a fuckin' circus on dorphs. Tool has a mishap, singes his synapses and his choom Shank decides to scroll him with Lina instead of callin' a ripper. A little fucked up? Sure, but money's money, right? Time to find Lina and somehow talk her into scrolling this BD at the Brainporium.

The dust has settled, the circus has closed down and the chimps have escaped. More specifically – Tool's gone into hiding someplace. What the hell were you thinking, telling him he's an FIA clone? Getting tangled up in this mess wasn't the best idea now, was it? Either way, the scroll's out there (a real masterpiece, mind you) and Shank paid what he was due. Another contract closed. Pleased with yourself?

Well done. The shock therapy worked – Tool's back to his old self. If only you had a few more months to live, I'd say you have some real potential as a shrink. The BD with Lina came out so-so and most likely won't rake in heaps, but who cares? What counts is you didn't let yourself get roped into Shank's gonk-ass plan and you helped out ol' Tool.

Go on, give yourself a pat on the back. Molding a starlet's one thing, but ushering her onto the global stage? That deserves a standing ovation. Lina and Tool being sisters is exactly the right kind of mass-market pulp that'll sell in Night City.\n\nWill Tool ever be himself again? Who cares, so long as the money's good, right? Stellar work, V. Contract closed.
In the future, check your clients.
Potent metaphor. Cook it up yourself?
Gettin’ pretty good at sweepin’ shit under the rug, huh?
Guess I got a soft spot for chooms who actually believe in something. Had to give her the biomon.
Wasn’t my decision to make – biomon’s their biz, not mine.
Ease off the threats. You got a second chance, push your luck and you might lose it.
Uh, nice one. Good luck, I guess.

Archived Conversation: Leilani Potts and Richard Espiritu
Great. Glad you found your purpose.
I’m an old hand in this game, V.
Perhaps, perhaps not. Spare yourself the mental effort.
Ah, but what’s in a name, V? All’s well that ends well – for us at least. Until our next contract.

Ah, so you wash your hands of the matter? Leaving others to bathe theirs in blood. I won’t stoop so low as to judge; I hate to be bored, just like you. Still, I do pity our agents. Until our next contract, V.
See the blue container? I'm waiting inside. Can't be too careful.
"Reasonable" Steven? Hard pass on that guy, gimme the worked up one any day. When you wanna meet?
No rush, no rush! Patience is a virtue :) Sending you my address in case you're around. Bye!
NetWatch owes you one now. So I think you owe me a little extra.
Don’t like surprises on the job. So you didn’t know NetWatch was sniffing around, or did you just not bother to tell me?
Had to wipe a whole robot army. Coulda warned me the Voodoo Boys were out there playing build-a-bot.
Not short or sweet. Expect a call from NetWatch. The suits were also sniffing around... Milko’s sudden death foiled their plans.
If you think I’ll raise your rate accordingly, think again.
Congrats. Glad I could help. Take care of yourself out there.
Wow. So NetWatch finally made themselves useful. Keep it up.
I don’t believe that tone was necessary, but OK, sure.
Money isn’t everything, Hands. Those people needed help. Sometimes kindness pays, y’know?
Speaking of, got a cure for megalomania? Anderson could use it. Maybe he means well, but he doesn’t get to decide who lives and who dies.
Find all the tarot graffiti in Dogtown.
Ask Misty about the new tarot cards you found.
Swear to christ, if one more person asks me that today...
Drop it, Hands. Tell you one thing, though. Last gig I do for the NCPD.
I’ll admit they’re not to my taste, but I won’t leap to extremes. I suppose pigs are people too, as it were. Until our next contract, V.
Prickly today, aren’t we? I'll make do without the details. If the clients are happy, then so am I. Until our next contract, V.
Believe in the guy, too. Got his work cut out for him, but if karma’s worth anything, the clinic’s got better days ahead of it.
Faith’s not enough. Odell needs staff, supplies, medicine... good intentions won’t buy a thing.
There is strong air flow coming from the other side of the wall, indicating there may be a hidden passage there.
This is Dogtown. Whether kindness has any currency here remains up for debate.
This is Dogtown. Whether kindness has any currency here remains up for debate.
I’ve heard certain rumors. I was not acquainted with Anderson, but I do know Odell. If his conscience allowed him to work in that clinic, it means they did more good than harm.
Either way, may we never be in a position to require its services.
Meet Songbird between 11:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
Not in any hurry, are you? Cuz I know you have the coordinates. I'll contact you again once you're there.
We shall see. Anderson never was the type to win friends or influence anyone with finesse. Perhaps Odell will have an easier time finding generous donors for the clinic.

Born in Budapest as Jagoda Szabó. Emigrated to Night City with his family the same year. 2066: sentenced to prison for embezzlement of Petrochem corporate funds. Released in 2068 on good behavior. Jago has since been a busy bee in Night City's underbelly.
In 2072, he helped lay the foundation of BARGHEST, and remained atop its organizational ranks due to his corporate skillset and large web of connections within the smuggling trade.
He presently seeks support for his claim to power in Dogtown from the Voodoo Boys. Last, and most certainly least, Jago is also an aficionado of purebred canines.
BARGHEST Officer, Chief Aide to Kurt Hansen
Enlisted in the NUS Marines in 2063. Twice decorated for commendable service. Thrice brought to military court on charges of insubordation (all dismissed under Col. Hansen's protective watch).
Took part in Operation Midnight Storm, but refused to demobilize after its conclusion. In 2071, officially designated a defector by Militech along with Hansen's entire unit.
He remains in Dogtown as the ex-colonel's most loyal disciple. The natural choice to succeed his throne.
Hands, discreet’s my middle name. You got it.
I’ll try not to shoot first. Promise.
You two still in touch? Wouldn’t think you’d have much to talk about.

Think this is it? The end of the story? Can we finally stop looking over our shoulders? Are we... free? I'd like to think so, but somethin' tells me this is only the beginning. You uncovered mysteries you didn't know existed. You made decisions whose consequences you couldn't anticipate. Most importantly, though, you still don't know how to save yourself. Always one step forward, two steps back. Same old shit.

Silence... Finally. Every time I think back to that first meeting with Songbird, I feel like I'm gonna blow chunks. The moment she made me fade out... A feeling worse than death. Believe me, I'm an expert on the subject. But now? Nothing. Not a peep. Not even an echo. As if she's far, far away, or... I dunno. Looks like it's just the two of us again. But for how long now, I wonder.

Wonder how Songbird's doin'. Maybe we ougha raised a toast to her too? Never really understood why people love to gawk at the moon with those vacant, dreamy expressions. But now... might have to give it a try myself. Meanwhile, you keep your nose to the ground so you don't step in any shit.
You delivered Rinder’s dog tag, well done. Contract closed. Out of curiosity, though... wherever did you find Hansen’s former friend?
Scavside. Weirdly enough, they helped him... choom was trying to offload his chrome, get the fuck outta Dtown.
In Pacifica. Wasn’t in the best of shape... choom practically neutralized himself.
Instead of symbols, I'd look for someone who can actually protect you in the future.

Well if that hamster in ur brain ever gets off his ass and gets those gears turnin again, just head for the elevator by the stadium entrance. The system will ping me if it gets a read on your biometrics then I'll open the way
V, a transfer will land in your account shortly. A thank you for your cooperation.

I still need a few days, but talk soon.
Thanks for lettin me know. But I gotta ask… what's the word on helping my sitch? Can we meet?

To piece together the transport's makeup and route, I had to go diggin through archived files. In any case, we got what we need - that's the important thing. Time we met up.

Fact 5: The Crystal Palace boasts the biggest win in gambling history. The record-breaking sum of 80 million eurodollars was won in a game of blackjack by a Greek citizen in 2069.

Chapter 3: Attractions

Your adventure to Tycho begins well before you even land! The lunar colony is located at the bottom of a 52 mile-wide and 2.8 mile-deep impact crater from which it takes its name. Commercial transportation services in Tycho offer additional orbital flights around Luna where you can see the dark side of the ivory satellite and revel in the unforgettable views of Earth vanishing behind its horizon.

Tycho's closest attractions are without a doubt the two operational Mass Drivers as well an ice mine. Popular day trips include the Tranquility Base where the Apollo 11 landed in 1969 and put the first man on the moon. Buzz Aldrin's legendary footprint can still be viewed in the small, but fascinating Museum of Space Colonization in Tycho.

It's worth extending your stay on Luna by another day just to visit its sister colony, Copernicus - famous for its zero-gravity pools.

The cowardice that became the expression of the tragic events at NCX stand at complete odds with the values held by the European Space Council. In these difficult times, our thoughts and prayers go out to our brothers and sisters in North America and the wider world.

The editorial team at News54 expresses its support and solidarity with all those who suffered from this barbarous act of aggression. We firmly believe that law and order shall prevail, and those responsible will be held accountable.

In remembrance of the heroic souls who every day gave it their all so that our spaceport would continue to blossom - especially the too-soon-departed members of the Department of Customer Retention. We shall meet somewhere along the way in another life.\n\nTill next time!
Jefferson Peralez, Mayor of Night City
