V, I parsed the data. Clearly the handiwork of a real pro. If I didn't know better, I'd say you recruited one of the firm's own. They gave us specifics on the exact route, the security detail, combat protocols, even the code assigned to their "passenger." CPX01-Foxtrot-Omega. That "omega" is a big sigh of relief for us. That's MaxTac's designation for unidentified persons. We caught a huge break here. Time we met up.

V, I parsed the data. Talk about complete - the file even contains archival data. Maybe that was intential - maybe they were in a rush. In any case, after some digging I found the info we need: security strategy, route, and even the code assigned to their "passenger." CPX01-Foxtrot-Omega. That "omega" is a big sigh of relief for us. That's MaxTac's designation for unidentified persons. We caught a huge break here. Time we met up.

V, I parsed the data. Decent enough work. A few blanks to fill in, but nothing we can't manage without. We got the transport's most probable security detail and, most importantly, the route. Time we met up.

Included are three robots to assist in complex minimally invasive surgical procedures, to be delivered to Arasaka headquarters in Night City. The custom devices may be used for cardiac, urology and neurosurgical procedures as well as to reverse cyberware implantation-induced nerve degeneration. We've also sent a self-contained medical unit and additional equipment requested by the hospital at the Night City headquarters.

Sit and wait for the meeting.

Jacob Bernard\nAge: 24\nDiagnoses: obsessive-compulsive disorder, ADHD, PTSD, delusions resulting from irreversible changes in the brain. According to the patient interview, the patient was trained as a basketball player in a special center, where he underwent a range of operations to enhance muscle strength and nerve conduction velocity. The patient also underwent several neural operations, as confirmed by MRI. The patient should continuously take medication to reduce aggression, delusions and general hyperactivity. Unfortunately, all medications to be taken by the patient are contraindicated due to potential drug interactions, which may lead to a worsening of the patient’s state.

You've made up your mind. Rightly so. Take good care of our gift. Get to know one another, help one another. You may be living on borrowed time, but your future is looking ever so slightly brighter. Good luck, V.

V... We know you took some interesting items with you from the heart of darkness. Prototype crafting blueprints developed in Cynosure, a rare chipset with even rarer anomalies... Worry not, we do not intend to take them back - on the contrary. It is encrypted with symmetrical algorithms that predate the DataKrash. We can help with that.
You surprise us, V. Your uncertainty, hesitation, your indecisiveness. A piece of unique technology rests at your fingertips. You know precisely how to unlock its potential. What is it you wait for?
Idleness is wasted potential. Disappointment. If you do not intend to use the chipset, it would be best to free yourself ot it. SELL IT.
You hesitate. We can cannot comprehend it. Why do you not choose the optimal outcome? You are in no position to turn down such a gift.
Yeaaah, no thanks. This stinks worse than Coronado Bay
Haven't decided what I'll do with it yet.

You will go see a netrunner who will decrypt the chipset. Her compensation and pledge of secrecy have been taken care of. You will obtain a functioning device from her. A lethal miracle of technology. In exchange the device will stream data to us. This will not affect your life in any way. Or rather your attempts at staying alive. We have transmitted coordinates.
That's all fine and dandy. But what's the catch?
Fuck off. Remove me from your database, calling list or whatever and never contact me again
There is no catch. You will grant us access to data from your reality. In exchange you will acquire technology that will allow you to better use the time you have left. It is a generous offer.

We understand that this emotional reaction comes from your limited cognitive abilities. We are not forcing you to do anything. Even if it is for your own good. If and when you decide to seize this opportunity, a netrunner will await you.

We think you know. And if you do not, then that should not be your worry. It is one of the billions of scraps of information preventing you from taking action. What matters is what we offer you now – technology that nobody else has access to.
We do not expect your trust. Trust if needed when the unknown is at play. Here, everything is self-evident. Can you truly not see that? This arrangement is of benefit to both parties.

You will go see a netrunner who will decrypt the chipset. You are acquainted with one another - a fact we deemed not insignificant. Her compensation and pledge of secrecy have been taken care of. 1/2 lb protein brick (third tier from biotechnica is enough)
2 onions (biohackers at the stadium have the best)
1 egg yolk (synthetic obvs)
water (well filtered)
synth-flour from petrochem
spices - whatever you can find (salt is a must have)

How to prepare: mix the flour with the synth-yolk, add some oil and then pour water. let rest for 30 mins.
Meanwhile, dice onion and fry. Crumble the protein brick and season to taste, then add onion to make the stuffing. Then form your pelmenis and put in boiling water. Boil until the pelmenis float.

Sienna is 47 years old and has been missing for two weeks. She was last seen at the Heavy Hearts club. Sienna is a petite woman with black hair and visible arm and face implants. If you've seen her, please contact her sister.

Patrick is 22 years old. Last week he left his home in the Stacks and has not returned. Patrick is of slim build, medium height, dark hair and was wearing blue jeans and a dark coat when he left. His distraught family is asking anyone with information about his whereabouts to contact them immediately.

My Tomas is only 11 years old and worked at the stadium as a runner and hasn't been back in over two weeks. I'm begging anyone for help - Tomas is a sweet boy, fully of energy, no cyberware, slim and of average height. He has short, brown hair and was wearing a blue hoodie.

Sienna Simon - chick's chipped with preem chrome from her corpo days, Arasaka memory enhacement, private ICE (no point trying to break through from up close or at a distance), Biotech Mk.3 cyberdeck and a monowire. You'll find her at the Heavy Hearts working the bar.

Eliana Zarate - Militech corpo who's supposed to drop by the stadium to do biz with a Sophia Dupont. Little missy's got her own driver, so best approach is to waste him first, klep the ride and wait for our helpless dame to get in. Then the usual - jam the biomonitor sig and strip her chrome down to the last screw.

Noah Schulholf - ripperdoc from stall 137 at the stadium, lives in the Stacks so nabbing him should be child's play. We want his arms, so don't break them. Clear?

Tomas Greenberg - be gentle with this one, okay? You'll put him to sleep and extract his spinal cord implant in the L5 section - Damir Kovac will handle him, he'll know the where and the how to the millimeter. Once Kovac is done with him, you drop the kid off at his mother's - THIS IS FUCKING IMPORTANT - Kovac is a delicate flower and could turn on us, so go gentle on the kid. Please.

Zachary Watson - Zetatech soldier doing biz with the Animals in Pacifica. We're already tracking his car - the second he strays into our neck of the woods, you'll know about it. He spends about 34-36 minutes in Pacifica. Thing is, choom's ripped like you've never seen, so close quarters is out of the question. You'll have to take him out from far. Thx, but no thx :)

Here's how this goes: first I crack the soft in certain biomonitor models, then I put each specific crack onto a shard and THOSE SHARDS ARE WHAT YOU GET FROM ME. If you have to jam the sig on a Militech  GUEST-9128AX biomon, then you slot the shard named "GUEST-9128AX CRACK" into your guy and the sig gets jammed.

Doesn't get simpler than that. Here it is laid out, play by play, in bullet points.

HOW TO KIDNAP PEEPS AND HACK THEIR BIOMONS FOR GONKS:

1. Biomonitors send an SOS to Trauma 15 seconds after connection is lost, interference is detected, or when vitals don't return to normal. Before those 15 seconds are up, my shard has to be inside your target.

2. Expose the target to a weak EMP signal before quickly taking them out and slotting the shard.

3. Some people have dummy chip slots (if the chip has a crack, TT'll get notified immediately) so never go after a target you haven't specced first.

4. You've got it easy in Dogtown - Trauma almost never shows. But they COULD drop here into Pacifica. So if you bring us some VIP from Night City who was having a few drinks at the Heavy Hearts, YOU'LL STILL NEED TO SLOT A SHARD WITH A CRACK. If you don't do that, then Trauma will be paying us a house call.

Tycho was founded in 1997 by the European Space Council. The Moon was chosen as the site for the first human settlement in space for obvious reasons: the presence of natural gravity and the relative softness of the ground. The city is located at the bottom of an awe-inspiring impact crater bearing the same name that measures 53 miles wide and nearly 3 miles deep.

By 2020, most of Tycho's structures had been moved underground. A network of caves and tunnels was hollowed out with atomic laser drills, and the ceilings were reinforced with molten lunar sand. Within the cave system, settlers created reserves of oxygen-producing plant life that accounts for most of breathable air in the community today.

According to data from 2075, Tycho boasts a population of approximately 40,000, and is the largest of two populated settlements (the other being Copernicus with a population of approximately 18,000 people). The transportation of raw materials from Tycho to Earth and to the nearby Crystal Palace space station is done via mass drivers. Two of these drivers are located in Tycho, the other at Copernicus. During the so-called First Orbital War in 2008, which lasted six hours, a 2-ton moonstone launched from a Tycho mass driver struck Colorado Springs. Most of the commanding officers of the NUS armed forces perished in the explosion, bringing an abrupt end to the conflict.
Entropy stabilization in the operator’s expanded consciousness has failed.

The maintenance robot "Cerberus" produced by Militech is one of the most advanced units of its kind. For a long time it remained in the prototype stage - Militech was very reluctant to publicize information about it, nor did it grant any external licenses or sell any models. The robot served only in Militech's research and technology facilities. Some models were equipped with practically indestructible armor and subsystems that allowed AI to work in tandem with the machine - in this respect, "Cerberus" was a technological marvel. These special versions of the robot were able to operate in the most extreme conditions, disregarding the dangers of radiation or electromagnetic discharge. Thanks to this, they were able to operate and maintain the cores at Militech's technological facilities, including those on the Moon.

I assume you’re an interested party – Kurt Hansen has given up the ghost while in the hospital. Unsurprisingly, all the hospital cameras malfunctioned at once, while the security guard went out for a smoke. In my professional opinion, someone took advantage of the situation, whether it was one of BARGHEST’s many competitors, an ambitious underling or an unhappy client – the exact party is immaterial. I’d urge caution, especially at this time, V. Hounds unleashed tend to bite.

Well, I'm no psychiatrist but this is ringing a bell from back when I was still cutting my teeth as a fledgling ripper. In those days it was known in the field as "induced identity". I remember it got some buzz in the 50s too, some kinda issue with the wreaths of the time. A number of those patients still haven't recovered.

Cases have been common enough to be decently well documented. As far as treatment, psychotherapy's had some success - pharmaceuticals not so much. The key is inducing cognitive dissonance in the patient. By exposing them to something personal from their true reality, you undermine the adopted one. Or so the theory goes. It's worth keeping in mind though that patients in such an unstable state exhibit high mental plasticity, making them susceptible to suggestion and manipulation. So watch your words - they're likely to take anything you say at face value, potentially further reinforcing their adopted identity.

I called, but I suppose a text message will do just as well: my thanks and warm regards. The data you sent me - fascinating. Invaluable. Excellent work, V. As a token of my appreciation, I’ve dispatched a small gift to your megabuilding apartment. Until our next gig.

Wonderful. The rest you may leave to me. You, focus on your business at hand. In the meantime, I’ll mark today’s date in my calendar - the day V truly began to impress me.
V. The delivery you awaited has arrived. Yoko has packed it up nicely and is waiting for you now – you know where. Good luck.
Little busy right now, will head over when I can.
Certainly. I’ve merely opened a door; it’s for you to step through it.
Wonderful. Happy hunting, whatever your quarry may be.

Gotta deal with somethin else first so sit tight

Have you lost you mind?! I wish to be rid of it immediately. Come now!
I trusted you and you let me down. Last time I make that mistake. Still, your failure to cooperate will cost you.
V, thanks for your help. I got what I needed... I'm glad I trusted you.
Wanna tell me what you need it for? Y'know, as a reward for my efforts?

Militech also made some modifications to this model's electronics, installing an autopilot function and ambient scanners, making it easier to move and fight in adverse conditions. The real icing on the cake? An automated combat turret, utilizing programmable ammunition.

A BARGHEST rookie who squeezes every opportunity that presents itself to the last drop. Extreme confidence combined with the naivety of youth have led him to try turning every situation to his benefit. And after? Somehow things will always work themselves out.\nConstantly on the move and full of "amazing" ideas, he fell into Hansen's bad graces almost immediately after joining BARGHEST. Since he acts first and thinks later, he likely won't learn much from his mistakes. If you're always one step away from a better situation, you have to take it, right? It's just logic.

A BARGHEST soldier with several years of experience under her belt. Sensible, pragmatic, and most importantly - Paco's best choom. She has, in a way, assumed the role of his older sister and tries her hardest to keep him from getting himself killed. She accepts most things as they are, doesn't like to stick her neck out, preferring to move on and forget.\nShe landed in Dogtown after her ex framed her for dealing in infected BDs and promptly vanished. After that incident she'd rather glide through life in peace and without risk. But then... she met Paco.

A Tech sniper rifle made by the renowned Tsunami. Its retrofuturistic design is a nod toward the original prototype of the series, which unfortunately never went into production. The revolutionary technology that allows you to reabsorb a portion of recoil energy and transfer it to the next shot is undoubtedly genius, but will burn a bigger hole in your pocket. Still, should you scrounge up the eddies and decide to buy, the Rasetsu will reward you with a lifetime of companionship.

The Canto Mk.6 is a deck that many netrunners and collectors consider an urban legend. A powerful Militech deck backed by the computing power of AI algorithms that was never mass-produced, using technologies that have yet to see the light of day - too good to be true? Maybe, especially since several models that appeared on illegal auctions turned out to be cleverly tweaked fakes of other Militech decks every time. And yet experts believe that the Canto Mk.6 exists, or rather: there was a very limited series of components that never made it into the wider market. The trick is to find these components - probably pilfer them from Militech's warehouses or buy them for heaps of eddies on the black market - and try to construct the Canto from them. Only then will the legend come to life....
Orbital Air welcomes you back to Night City International and Translunar. Thank you for using our services again. We wish you a pleasant journey.

Low-riding, fast, ostentatious yet classy. The "Charon" zips around town like a cheetah in heat, keeping you pleasantly weighted down as you accelerate while the engine purrs at a relaxing 512 Hz. It can be a sensory experience, if you let it. The dark, elegant interior is calming and soothing, allowing you to speed through the roads in a meditative state. Whether you're lead-footing the gas through Night City's main arteries or the endless desert - it's good to haul ass in premium class, even if there's a company logo stamped on it. Charon Exotics has some extortionate, redundant services, but this sure as hell ain't one of them. If anyone knew that, it was the Cassel twins.

Was that a surfer just now, riding atop a silvery wave? No, that was the Quadra Sport R-7 "Sterling" shredding Night City's litter-covered streets and splashing its residents with sewage and oil-slicked rainwater. Gnarly, choom.

Mr. Hands is well aware there's no such thing as a second impression - only the first. That's why he chose a silver paint called "Mercury Swell" for this custom Quadra. "Silver, not gold?" you might be asking. Please... Mr. Hands doesn't do "kitsch." He bucks convention and, of course, only treasures products of the finest quality. No wonder, then, that his model of choice was the Sport R-7.

Mr. Hands' reputation may precede him, but his Quadra "Sterling" precedes all else.

Fall. The season of decay. I'm not a part of the equation anymore. They'll manage just fine without me. I'll manage even better without you. Evolution carries on and humans are just a stopgap. Between us and what they are lies a vast, yawning void. Another missing link.

Fall. A time of departing. I'll leave this place. Pacifica? Maybe. Maybe even further if they let me. The whispers keep following me. Unwanted travel companions that I don't know how to live without anymore.

Fall. A time of rebirth? I look around and start to think like they do - this world doesn't deserve to be saved. Are these even my own thoughts anymore?

December 12. I feel a lot better. The whispering stopped as soon as I left that place. I still hear them sometimes in my sleep. That and the dripping water. But that's in the past - my whole future lies ahead of me. I have to find something, anything so I don't end up on the streets - even though I'm already at the bottom.

December 21. They're here after all. They could be anyone. Everywhere. Sometimes I sense them - nesting in the people walking past. In their cyberware. In the traffic lights. Under the hoods of cars. They're there. Waiting. For what? Maybe for the end of the world, which would be the beginning of theirs. Hope is dead.

December 24. I dreamt of snow... Gray and thick, like an effervescent blanket. And behind them silhouettes... stared at me. In judgment. They weren't pleased that I left that place. I even miss it a little... Or maybe I miss them? For the whispers between the droplets splashing on the floor... Someone get me out of here...

Looking for raw, gonzo experiences? Lina Malina is not just the Queen Bitch of Dogtown, but of braindances too. The rules are simple - fire up a scroll and immerse yourself in Lina's crazy world until smoke starts coming out of your ears. Every frame comes packed with sex and action amped to the max with the latest designer, brain-melting drugs.
Already a fan? Can't live without Lina? Then head to the store to check out the preemest merch or drop a review for all the leadheads that can't keep up with the times.
In the mood? Then get comfy on that couch and stuff your hand down where it belongs, 'cause it'll be a show to remember.
Stock up on merch during the next fan meet!

Straight-up, no holds barred, to the point - that's what I love about Lina's social commentary. Like when they hit that road sign and Lina sprayed piss all over the speed limit - a middle finger aimed directly at the regulatory powers that be. The apotheosis of freedom of post-neoliberal expression.

Congrats on being able to pull an interpretation from your ass. Seriously, go back and watch Lina's earliest scrolls, especially the Badlands series. Taken in a broader context, it's clear that Lina's a syndico-accelerationist and stunts like the public urination is a statement against the anachronism of the body in our cyborg-obsessed culture.

Corps and gangs: Yin and yang

Wassup dickbags and pussycaps- it's FR34K_S33K at your fuckin' service with some oh-so-fresh news. I be watching what strings those slender-ass corpo fingers be pulling, cuz if I don't do it, who the fuck will?

So you know how corps always blaming shit on "gang wars" like they ain't the ones fucking supplying the heat and lead and stirring up the beef? No surprise, right? Everyone know that. But corps planting agents in every major gang on the streets of Night City sounds a bit like overkill, don't it? First up, you gotta ask yourself why? Cuz they can't control everything? Nah, we been there and we know they're damn well capable of that. If corps wanna put boots on the ground, plant moles up in a-holes, they'll do it - we've seen them do it a thousand times. So I don't doubt for a second they'd have a huge resource like this city's gangs twirled around their manicured pinky fingers. Allow me to explain.

First of all: information. Gangs know the sitch on every goddamn street corner. Pretty important for biz, right?

And on that note, the second reason: control. Cuz if you're in a branch of, I dunno, the Tyger Claws - you're part of the basic fabric of peeps' fucking everyday lives. I'm talkin' owning bars, clubs, legit biz employing peeps on actual goddamn contracts.

And now for the motherfucking cherry on the tippity top: "But don't the badges know about this?" And I'd answer: what's the diff? Only thing that matters is that there's the big fish and the little fish - meaning us.

But even more important than that? Knowing it, being awake and aware. And that's why you've got FR34K_S33K! I keeping my eyes and ears open so I can tell you like it is!

Listen up, cuz I'm about to drop some big brain shit on y'all: crime statistics in this city fluctuate according to some chosen value, right? It might be a little scary, or a little comforting - above all it's easy for us to swallow. Some apparatchik at the top already did the math, tested it and is feeding us juuuust the right percentages. You might've already guessed they're based on total bullshit, but the fact that they depend on YOU is a hot take you'll only get from FR34K_S33K! Someone made a fat eurobuck researching which numbers multiplied by what kind of news give the desired results, made some neat tables for the peeps in charge and voila! They've got their own copy-paste crisis management system. Depending on the political moves in the works, they're planning how you'll feel - that's right, you Mr. and Miss Nobody - and they feed you those stats any way they possibly can. Your anxieties, your comforts, safety and good night's sleep are all carefully calculated. They're playing this city like one big fucking church organ cuz they understand it's enough to blast peeps with data they ain't got no way of verifying. Simple, right?

And then they wanna nail peeps like me so that all that info go down niiiiice and easy without a second thought. So I'm saying it loud and clear: OVER MY DEAD FUCKING BODY. We got a right to THINK for ourselves!

Keep coming back for more FR34K_S33K, cuz I ain't going nowhere! Full spread ahead, baby!

Wassup choombas and choombettes! I gots another grain of fucked up truth for y'all. FR34K_S33K's always on the lookout!

Lemme start with a question - you know the MedCenter hospital? I mean, who wouldn't, right? Besides the few of y'all praying not to end up there, cuz once they through with you, you're hitting the bricks with a giant-ass bill to boot.

I'll start general and go specific - every company optimizes its taxes, right? Cuz if you can, you'd be a gonk not to. And what's the best way? Charity! Good money and PR in one fell swoop - roses really do smell like poo-poo-ooh! But what can they really donate? Cash? Yeah fucking right. Equipment? They ain't that wacked. What don't you wanna keep forever cuz they got an expiry date, but instead of throwing them away you can donate them just before they go bad? Bingo! Fucking meds! It's the perfect tax write-off. "So what?" you might ask. By and large, it's probably a good thing.

Not so fast, choom - it's a clever little smoke and mirrors racket that's hard to wrap your little skullsponge around. But that's why you got me!

The hospital donates its expired almost-expired meds to a different organization every time so they can't be accused of playing favorites, taking bribes and whatnot. Except all those "organizations" are registered to companies in Pacifica - only losses, zero activity, one bankruptcy after another. Y'all smell where this is going, right? Stanky!

Now look here, cuz I did some actual fucking fieldwork that'd be worthy of media screentime or even a plug from that poser Max Jones! Anyway - those meds all end up in Dogtown! And I get you might be still be saying "Whatever, choom, better than tossing them into the trash" except once they get there they slap on new expiry dates and pump them into the city! OUR city! And you know where those trucks go? You guessed it - the fucking MedCenter. Unmarked trucks, unmarked boxes, rear offloading area, irregular deliveries... Clever - but not clever enough to fool FR34K_S33K and therefore y'all too, cuz I bet y'all ain't saying "Whatever" now!

So to sum up: charity? Check. Money? Yup. Some meds for Dogtown? Why not. Part of the expired meds making their way back to the hospital? Abso-fucking-lutely! All pros, no cons! Except for the patients, but who gives a shit about them? What matters is that their profit margins widen, someone gets promoted, the accounting nerds are patting each others backs, jerking each other off, padding their yearly bonuses... and us? Yeah, we're not part of that fucking equation.

Y'all already know that FR34K_S33K don't sugarcoat nothing - I only tell it like it is. No topic's too heavy for this fool. Bring it!

Wassup, all you losers, winners and inbetweeners!

Remember that scandal at the Biotechnica Academy a few years back? "Scandal's" a bit of an exaggeration seeing as the noise fizzled out and the media's hard-on went dead limp quick. Bribes here, greased palms there - part and parcel of our daily existence, ain't it? The cornerstone of our society?

So why, you ask, is FR34K_S33K digging up old, forgotten shit? Don't the Net give me enough to sink my teeth into?

Here's the thing - whatever's on the Net you can find yourselves. I bring you the exclusive shit, feel me? The motherfucking cherries on your informational scop sundaes.

Let's rewind to that scandal: a teacher from the Biotechnica Academy, Emerson Cobb, accepted fat-ass bribes on multiple occasions and boosted students' test scores so they could cockroach their way into Biotechnica's ranks. Welp, that pissed off the megacorp something fierce - it's one thing to take bribes (who doesn't?), it's another to dilute their performance. For that, muthafuckas pay the price. So they handed it over to the NC Court of (ahem!) "Justice" and conducted their own investigation.

And then? Poof! Our choom vanished into NC's thick, smog-choked air.

That is, until a few years later when a braindance called "The First and Last" came out - not half bad, in fact. And guess who's mug I spy in it? Son of a bitch clearly paid some ripper a pretty enny for a full-face conversion, but it was him, all right... Emerson fucking Cobb!

And ya know what else? He's still in Night City! Former students - I recommend paying a visit to Clouds... Don't pretend like y'all can't afford it! I'ma keep things entertaining and not spill his stage name. You'll just have to be faster than the pigs! Last one is the rotten egg!

So remember, kids: life's gonna fuck us all in the end one way or another. And when that happens, I, FR34K_S33K, will be there to tell y'all like it is.

You've subscribed to Pixel Fortress! Receive new reviews every week!\n\nWe review your all favorite games, from unforgettable classics to the hottest new releases! Because we don't rely on corporate sponsorships, expect only the rawest, most unbiased and unfiltered opinions in video game journalism today.
INTERSTELLAR COMMANDER 6: Saving the Galaxy… Again!

The legendary Interstellar Commander series is BACK! After years of anticipation fans can once again board the Burgundy and travel at light speed to save the galaxy. But can the sixth installment of this beloved franchise still pack the same "oomph"? Or has it devolved into a lukewarm pile of "meh"? We've got the answer!

Interstellar Commander 6: The Hunt for Baron Octavian still has everything that made us gush the series' previous entries. Spectacular battles on dazzling space stations? Check! Exploration of jaw-dropping exoplanets? You got it! Shocking plot twists? Affirmative! Yes, the controversial ending has been hard for some die-hard fans to swallow, but you'll have to experience it for yourself.

Your mission: to track down the infamous, yet charismatic Baron Octavian who ticks all the boxes of a villain on a galactic scale. Our interaction with him largely depends on whether we go down the Paladin or the Scoundrel path. Multiple playthroughs are well worth the chance to discover the many facets of Octavian! It's just too bad the devs didn't make him into a romance option... but hey, that's what mods are for, right?

Speaking of romance, we should emphasize that this adventure isn't just a rollercoaster ride of emotions, but also gives opportunities to really, erm... form deeper connections with your crewmembers and strengthen bonds with previous characters from the franchise.

The popularity of a certain braindance of dubious quality and origin (relive at your own peril) which lets you find out whether the Burgundy's cannon is a worthy substitute for a bed (spoiler: it isn't), leads us to believe players of all genders and tastes will be pleased. Especially given the return of all-time favorite Garriux, who hasn't lost an ounce of enthusiasm for carrying out his, ahem, calibrations...

Long story short, hunting down Baron Octavian across the universe is going to be helluva good time for all diehard fans of the series. As for you new potential players out there, how will you feel in the commander's polished space boots? Confident and capable, we hope! After all, the galaxy won't save itself!

Roach Race's pixelated protagonist may have never won a championship in equestrian show jumping, but she has won the hearts of retro game fans around the world. We're left asking: Is she worthy?

The journey of this glitchy, often bipedal mare as overcomes wave after wave of obstacles was clearly created to serve as tribute to other arcade classics. Roach Race treats players to eye-catching visuals and a wicked soundtrack that stretches the potential of 8-bit gaming to its zenith. The controls are largely intuitive, though newcomers have been known to complain. (It doesn't help that the game lacks a tutorial.)  While some players have bemoaned the quirky control system, others welcome the unintended skill gap which, they say, "keeps filthy casuals off the leaderboard. "

Yet... from a narrative perspective, we ended our time with Roach Race still guessing at the protagonist's motivations. A topic on which the creators have long remained silent.

Is it commentary on late-stage capitalism – a metaphor for the ceaseless corporate treadmill, always racing for another carrot? But then what or whom does the horse's white-haired tormentor represent? Was the vagueness of her motivation a deliberate design choice, intended to suit any player's interpretation or personal experience? Or maybe... it's just a game about a horse. Hungry for snacks and giving her owner grief.

We recommend hopping in the saddle and deciding for yourselves.

A title we never asked for, and a title we don't deserve. Indie French studio Château de Rais has returned us once again to the pitiable fate of the medieval peasant. While the previous two installments were criticized for clumsy gameplay and overall lack of realism (and rightly so, we all remember the infamous "path of the fire shaman"), the franchise's creators have learned from these difficult lessons. They now invite players to experience "the harshest autumn of the Middle Ages" using a revamped VR system. After several hours of early-access gameplay, we can confirm – this is no mere marketing ploy.

Let's start with the fact that FPS3 offers only one difficulty setting: "Sick & Feeble". The in-game tasks themselves seem relatively straightforward. Hauling sacks of grain and buckets of shit from place to place was right in my character's wheelhouse from the get-go. Grooming horses, digging ditches, pitching tents in peat bogs, on the other hand... not so much. And this game shows no mercy. The tiniest slip-up and you're at the end of a whip or under your lord's boot. Also, the fact that the NPCs speak exclusively in Old French or Latin doesn't make things any easier. Turn on the subtitles, you say? Sorry, there aren't any. Peasants are illiterate, after all.

Now a quick word about the highly touted world exploration system. All map traversal takes place in real time. Now, technically you play as a serf, bound to your lord's estate. You can try to hide yourself in an outgoing wagon, covered in horse manure. If you do and are discovered, you guessed it – crack of the whip. Great, you're at low health, but eating the moldy bread and rotten turnips in your inventory doesn't help. All that gave you was dysentery. BUT, this is where the realism and world reactivity shine. Dysentery means frequent trips to the bushes. Hiding in a bush helped me set a survival PR of 5 hours. Of course, in the end, I was still flogged to death by some noble French asshole who had a lot to say (mean things, I assume).

Ultimately, Feudal Peasant Simulator 3 presents an interesting question: At what point does suffering in a sim go from fun times to genuinely insufferable times? I don't exactly know how this is possible, but I think this game actually gave me real-world back problems. 10/10, would play again. This title is a must have for history buffs with masochistic tendencies. Knowledge of Old French recommended.
ARASAKA TOWER: Down with the Man(ager)!

Arasaka Tower... the mere mention of which causes Arasaka corporate lawyers to start violently convulsing and hot-dialing their spec ops teams. Though the game saw the light of day a decade ago, it's still very much a bone of legal contention. Its sale was outlawed on all continents and only exists today in the form of pirate copies on the black market and in the farthest corners of the Net. On the 10th anniversary of the game's release, we're here to remind you what really happened.

"Arasaka Tower" is a simple arcade hack-'n'-slash set in the offices of the eponymous corporation. The player takes on the role of an anonymous middle manager whose goal is to go floor by floor until he reaches his boss's office. The way to the top won't be easy though, which is why the developers supply you with an arsenal of unconventional weapons - from staplers and rolls of duct tape, to photocopiers, fire extinguishers, reception desks and a security guard named Bob who's pissed off about his low salary.

More importantly, on every floor you come across, you can find a variety of classified documents. Their contents are so comprehensive and suspiciously authentic that many have wondered if the developers hadn't actually made them up. Could it be... this game is, in fact, a cleverly disguised data leak from the heart of the corporation? Or maybe a false flag operation meant to throw off the competition?

Whatever the case, Arasaka Tower (the game) has birthed a slew of conspiracy theories. Apparently, a few players who managed to reach the top disappeared under suspicious circumstances (IRL). Rumor has it, at the top one can find confirmation of the data leak from the corporation's highest echelons. Apparently Hanako Arasaka (talented netrunner in her own right) once dreamed of a career in game development... You see where we're going with this?

As with many conspiracy theories, maybe this one also contains a grain of truth. In any case, if the editorial staff of Pixel Fortress mysteriously disappears, you'll know we've been paid a visit by men in tailored, Japanese suits.

Things are heating up again in Heywood! The NCPD reports that 6th Street and the Valentinos are at each other's throats again after a brief hiatus of relative calm. Our report? Big Trouble in Little Heywood is BACK after months of obscurity and is topping the charts of the most popular games! Coincidence???

In case you missed it... Big Trouble in Little Heywood is an augmented reality (AR) game that has players taking on the role of seasoned, grizzled badges with who've been in the NCPD for too damn long. Although bitter and jaded, they're still ready to step up as the last line of defense in a city rotten to the core with vice and corruption. Their goal? Liberate Heywood from El Chamuco Endiablado - an S.O.B. like no other - and his merciless goons.

You won't find any deep meaning here: it's a straight run 'n' gun, shoot 'em up, race against time to drop as many gangers as you can. That a problem? Didn't think so! 'Cause it's the best part of the game! And let's not forget the preem retrowave soundtrack that gives Big Trouble in Little Heywood its distinctive flair.

No matter how you slice it, in virtual Heywood YOU are the one dishing out justice and leaving ganger corpses in your wake. As opposed to the real Heywood, where... well, you know how it is. And now you can see why this game is experiencing a resurgence in popularity unseen since its original release. It even snagged the honor of being voted our "Game of the Week", surpassing even the likes of all-time hits like Interstellar Commander 6!
BIG TROUBLE IN LITTLE HEYWOOD: Our Game of the Week

Kerry Eurodyne's career has taken off into the stratosphere! As the star himself admitted in his latest interview on WNS: "I feel like I've been reincarnated into my second - no - third life. It's preem, I'm diggin' it."\nThe rockerboy hinted that new songs are in the works and the tours he's planned will make  you dizzy. Literally.

No doubt you remember the Kerry's infamous, scandalous, emotional rollercoaster of a concert tour featuring Us Cracks! What a ride! The "Eurodyne On Cracks" will go down in history as one of the biggest musical events of the last decade. Meanwhile, the planet's last true rockerboy is busy scheming up more surprises for us.

Hot off the heels of a sold-out concert tour in Europe, Kerry has turned his gaze to the stars to become... Crystal Palace's rockerboy in residence! "You're gonna try telling me that a multi-millie euro contract on a fucking space station is proof I've finally gone off the deep end. Wrong. That happened ages ago. This is just me turning my dreams into reality," Kerry said at the station's press conference announcing the initiative, which will include dozens of performances. Count on Kerry performing his greatest hits and knocking us off our feet with his legendary, unmistakable sound updated for a new generation! We can hardly wait!

At the turn of 20th century, Sasai Arasaka founded a small manufacturing operation in Tokyo. Thanks to his endurance and wise judgment, the company survived World War II, only to flourish under the leadership of Saburo Arasaka into a megacorporation.\nToday, following the death of Saburo Arasaka, the business empire blossoms once again under the enlightened hand of his heir, Yorinobu Arasaka, and stands on the cusp of even greater achievements.
Used mostly for patrolling corporate premises, but can be used to control the battlefield and carry out recon missions
Equipped with proximity sensors, explodes upon identifying a nearby foe

Doctor of Medicine (M.D.), surgical specialist, graduate and former lecturer at the Washington Medical Institute, where he his focused on and excelled in the field of neurosurgery.

Assistant to Dr. Anthony Anderson and a Catholic minister by vocation. His last parish was Haven in Dogtown. Due to the fall in the number of believers, the church building was repurposed as a clinic and infirmary o treat the impoverished and functions to this day under Dr. Anthony Anderson's watch. Despite the lack of a medical education, Blanco provides basic care for patients and also provides spiritual guidance and comfort when needed.

Access to universal healthcare is a basic right. We don't have official data, but it's estimated that more than half of all Dogtown residents have never visited a doctor and one-fifth have fallen into extreme poverty due to medical debt.

Haven's mission is to help Dogtown's poorest residents and to ease their pain and suffering simply because they can't afford a doctor, vital operations and basic medication. We don't charge a eurocent for your stay or any services provided, while everyone involved in the clinic's day-to-day operations works pro bono.

Haven is able to stay afloat thanks to our generous donors who refuse to turn a blind eye to others' suffering. Will you? Consider joining our team or supporting us with a donation.

Haven needs your help in order to continue helping others! If you're as sensitive as us to the injustices faced by the most vulnerable, then become a donor! Below you'll find a list of items that our patients need and will suffer without.

- Medication: painkillers, anti-flu, anti-diarrhea, sleeping pills, anxiety pills
-immunosuppressants
- implants (including used)
- Bandages and disinfectant
- disposable needles
- saline
- tourniquets
- surgical tools: scalpels, scissors, tweezers, needle holders, forceps
- Mattresses, bedsheets, blankets, towels

Thanks to the generosity of one our clinic's former patients, we've acquired a functioning cold-storage room. Maintaining precisely the right temperature is crucial for properly storing a large variety of medication and preparations.\nSince our utility bills have increased, we encourage everyone who supports our cause to make a donation.

Haven is celebrating another huge achievement! Dr. Anthony Anderson successfully performed a liver transplant on a patient whose own had succumbed to failure likely due to a severe hepatitis C infection. The healthy liver's donor was a patient of the clinic who, sadly, a few days before had been declared braindead. Since the transplant, the patient reports feeling well and is soon to be discharged from our clinic to embark on a new chapter in his life - this time minus the pain.\nIf anyone is considering donating their organs in the event of their death, we strongly recommend you choose our clinic as the beneficiary!

Haven's doors are open to anyone who wants a free vaccine against diphtheria, tetanus and whooping cough! One dose guarantees you protection against three infectious bacterial diseases that have claimed an increasing number of lives in Dogtown over the past few years. Thanks to the generosity of a pharmaceutical company (who asked to remain anonymous) we've received 1,500 vaccine doses that are only slightly expired.\n\nStop by Haven and help our community build immunity!

HELP NEEDED! WE WERE ATTACKED BY SCAVENGERS! They took over the clinic and IMPRISONED Anthony ANDERSON! We don't know if he's still ALIVE! Patients are left out on the STREET, we're CUT OFF from our equipment and meds! WE'RE SCARED!\nIf you're reading this, SEND HELP!!!

We're saved! The scavengers have left the clinic and Dr. Anthony Anderson is alive and safe!!! Luckily, not a single one of our patients was harmed throughout the ordeal, though we were almost scared to death…\nWe're grateful to V, a very brave woman and kind soul who came in our hour of need!\nMeanwhile, we're returning to our normal routines and duties even though the premises are in complete disarray. If you'd like to help us restore the clinic to a functional state, we're in dire need of a new window pane in the building's side entrance (broken by the scavengers).

entries.femaleVariant: Michał Kiciński i Marcin Iwiński - childhood chooms whose sheer passion for braindance and biz smarts proved it's possible to start a BD business on the other side of the world in the eccentric, beating heart of Night City in Dogtown
Our adventure began in 2074 when we came to America to start our own business. We decided to open our BD store  to supply Dogtown with USSR-imported samizdat braindances.

Soon we'll be signing our first contract with an authorized braindance distributor for all of Night City, while you, our dear customer, will for years be able to brag about how you were buying BDs from "Good Old Dogtown" before they went big.

Take on the role of the Chosen One, embark on a mind-blowing adventure and become the savior of a world filled with wizards, dragons and tribal princesses. This uniquely-designed, hands-on directed braindance production features real actors, extras and virtual sets. On such a shoe-string budget, it's a true masterpiece! So what are you waiting for? Gather your party and begin the adventure of a lifetime!
The last-ever stunt braindance scrolled by the two-wheeled trailblazer himself, Brian "Comet" Sanders, who races across the rooftops of Kabuki until he meets his spectacular end! Realfeel guaranteed!

Have you ever wondered what a mass murderer feels when he fires into a crowd of unarmed civilians? Well, you won't get that here. Instead, our braindance "Behind The Lens" will provide you the peace and relaxation felt by a corporate CEO during their morning meditation in a bamboo garden. We live in a world full of excitement, but who can say they feel truly RELAXED? Give it a shot!

"We're staying, over and out!" - so went Col. Hansen's famous declaration that ended his career at Militech and paved the founding for BARGHEST. At the end of the Unification War, a cabal of top fucko-politicos signed a peace treaty and wearing fake smiles for the camera simultaneously dicked over their soldiers - those same ones who just a few days earlier had secured the southernmost part of Pacifica after losing half of their battalion. We were ordered to advance at all costs, then suddenly retreat - no plan to bring back our KIA'd brothers and sisters. To that we said "HELL NO!" We knew our future couldn't depend on the whims of corrupt politicians and corporate shills for whom we were just numbers on a spreadsheet. We tossed our uniforms and hunkered down on this debris-filled strip of no man's land. In the first days we numbered only a handful, but our promise of freedom brought in new volunteers - Night Citizens who were forced to live on the margins and found hope among our ranks.

It wasn't easy at the start. If you were in Night City in 2070, you saw the smoldering pile of rubble that became of southern Pacifica. The leaders of Night City wanted to roll in with bulldozers and raze the whole thing to the ground. But for the second and last time, we said "HELL NO!" Together with residents we took matters into our own hands and starting rebuilding what's now known as Dogtown. We repaired critical infrastructure, provided electricity, ensured basic healthcare. But not everyone was happy about our achievements. They called as gangoons, terrorists, a tumor growing out of the city - the kind that needs excising without hesitation. To protect Dogtown and its residents from the encroachments of corporate-backed City Hall, we said "HELL NO!" for the third time and built a wall. Everyone here remembers the Burning December of '71, when BARGHEST together with volunteer groups once again defended the district from police and corp-backed militias. United, we persevered. Today we're still here and we're not fucking planning on going anywhere.

What will the future bring? Most likely another attempt to torpedo out initiatives, along with acts of sabtoage, provocations and smear campaigns from Night City's leaders. Our answer is and always will be the same: get fucked. BARGHEST stands in defense of Dogtown and its residents' freedom. Our organization boasts hundreds of volunteers ready to take up arms for their fundamental rights. Soon there will be thousands. We stand against systems of oppression, we spit in the faces of corrupt badges and bureaucrats, we are immune to the schemes of greedy corporations. BARGHEST is a force that THEY will have to reckon with.

Have the police tossed you into a holding cell for no reason again?
Gangs shot up the wrong car and it happened to be yours?
Still haven't been able to pay your fixer for the last job?

Why not say "Fuck it" to all of the above and choose BARGHEST instead?

If you're here, you've already asked yourself the most important question. Time to take that next step.

BARGHEST has been actively recruiting since 2070. Our ranks are hundreds-strong with ordinary folks just like you.

We offer a reasonable salary, professional gear, necessary training and basic health insurance.

Though we do not require experience, BARGHEST is looking for "freelancers", security and former police officers. We also welcome ex-gang members under the condition of additional vetting.

We do not require references. Proof of a clean record NOT welcome.
Your new life in Dogtown is waiting.\n\nReport to the nearest recruitment point or contact Lt. Col. Bennett directly.
Comfort and style for affordable rates
Our company was founded to provided elite services to elite business and individual clients. We understand the importance of riding in comfort and style and ensure a high degree of flexibility.

In our fleet you'll find the latest luxury car models that are equipped and polished to the highest standard. Whether you're planning a long trip, or a short leisurely drive, our vehicles will ensure a feeling of luxury at every turn.

Thanks to the flexibility of our services, you can try out every car in our fleet depending on your needs and inclinations. Elegance for daily commutes and high speed and brawn for a weekend romp? Our client managers will find the perfect solution to match your tastes. Complete your self-image with a car from Charon Exotics!

Vista Del Rey Celebrates As Hector Sacristán Faces Charges

Here's a sentence you won't read every day: Night City just became a slightly better place to live. Valentino head honcho Hector Sacristán, scourge of Vista Del Rey's peace-loving community, has been arrested and is now being held on charges that could have him facing life behind bars.

While the Valentino leader had been previously linked to a variety of felonies, including large-scale drug distribution and a series of unsolved murders and disappearances, all prior attempts at detaining Sacristán failed miserably, with our reporters detailing baffling negligence by local law enforcement. It took the involvement of the district attorney's office to turn things around. 

Thanks to witness testimony regarding the disappearance of Marcos Ferreira, another prominent Night City gang member, NCPD divers were able to retrieve Ferreira's body from Coronado Bay and provide enough evidence to make the arrest.

The DA's office hopes the autopsy will provide further proof of Sacristán's involvement. DA Georgina Zembinsky believes her office has a solid case and Sacristán's lawyers have their work cut out for them. "We finally put Hector Sacristán where he belongs and will do everything in our power to ensure he stays there forever," said Zembinsky during a press conference held on the Night City courthouse steps. Let's hope she can deliver.

Are you a strong, healthy, young man? Do you like warm climates? Want to travel the world and earn some cash while you're at it?
Look no further! Reputable Asian construction firms are looking for go-getters like you to lend a hand at luxury skyscraper construction sites in newly-built, sun-drenched metropolises. Send your application and together and help us lay the foundations for the megacities of the future!
We offer:

- Flexible zero-hour contracts for the full construction duration
- comprehensive health insurance
- competitive hourly pay
- paycheck in hand each week
- bonuses and paid overtime
- free room and board, including transport!
- access to health care

Don't wait! Limited spaces available on our transcontinental* flights!

*Departure from NCX, Terminal A, Flight no. OA 1222
What happened to the passengers of flight OA 1222?

The tragic fate of passengers aboard flight OA 1222 from Night City to Guangzhou, China is a mystery that has quickly become imaginative fuel for conspiracy theorists.

To recap: contact with the eighty-four men who boarded the OA TerraLines aircraft on the day of the NCX massacre was lost shortly after landing at their destination. It has been established that all of the missing passengers successfully went through passport control upon their arrival - there is therefore no doubt that they arrived at their destination safe and sound. Surveillance cameras last saw the men entering a bus in the parking lot of the spaceport. What became of them after is an ongoing mystery.

According to testimony from the families of the missing passengers, the men were to be employed by a "reputable Asian construction firm" that was reportedly seeking workers to help build a new metropolis. However, the NCPD's investigation has shown that no such project is currently being undertaken in the the People's Republic of China. Furthermore, the tickets for flight OA 1222 were paid for from an account that was immediately deactivated after the purchase, while its owner was revealed to be fake.

Is it possible that the mssing eighty-four willingly left behind their previous lives and cut off all contact with their families? Or maybe the answer is to be found in the shady corners of the international labor market? Let's hope that the reward for any useful information offered by Orbital Air will offer up new leads in this tragic case.

Farida is not the typical doctors' daughter who simply followed in their footsteps. Even as a child, she understood that ideals mainly serve those who are - or strive to be - in power. When her mother was accused of murdering a member of Iran's elite on the operating table, the family was forced to flee the country. They found asylum in the NUSA, where Militech immediately took advantage of her parents' skills and prepared young Farida for her profession by tossing her headfirst into the Unification War as soon as her training was complete.\n\nFarida ended up in Hansen's unit, which was sent to Night City. There she witnessed once again how power distorts ideals. Hansen, however, gave her a clinic and, in a way, a free hand. Now the ripper maintains the cyberware of BARGHEST soldiers and private clients alike while keeping her head down, hoping that once she saves up enough, she can walk away and maybe even return to Iran. In the meantime, as long as she has the option, she doesn't refuse to help her old contacts, for despite the many disappointments over the years, she still feels like an NUSA soldier.

Evan, you were right about those twins. Except it's not because they're from Europe, or that they get a cushy office instead of slumming it like the rest of us - it's just that they're whacked in the head. The brother especially. During connection he doesn't say a word, just stares at you with his dead eyes like he's planning your murder. Either way, they're starting to assert themselves, give us orders, question our expertise. Almost like they're afraid of something. Did you know they suggested to the board that we should start wrapping things up here soon? I don't know, maybe this is just the paranoia talking, but I get the feeling they don't want us to get to the bottom of our research here. So then who the fuck are they really working for?! Don't write back. I don't even know if I'll actually send this. I already feel better just getting this off my chest.

See ya around,
Lisa

If an artist cannot see the intrinsic purpose of their own artistic expression... can we as viewers? The purpose of the work by graffiti artist AMPS is up for debate, but we can at least attempt to examine it through two lenses: the artistic and the societal.

Given the relative consistency across AMPS' work, I argue the graffiti tag itself should not be the focus of our analysis, but rather where it appears and the frequency with which it appears. Once we establish this, we can better frame the work in the context of Dogtown's social power structure.

From this perspective, I view AMPS' tags as a fairly universal expression of marking one's territory or declaring one's presence. He sets out to show that the district is home, but in so doing also voices a clear objection to the BARGHEST regime and creates a kind of counterbalance to the organization's omnipresence.

AMPS' tag could serve as a response to the incessant announcements, pervasive symbols and oppressive rules that saturate nearly all aspects of life in Dogtown. Through these tags, AMPS demonstrates that individuals still live in this place and these individuals give it strength. Dogtown belongs to the people. All we must do is reclaim it.

Of course, it's possible such was never a thought in AMPS' mind while painting these tags. If that is the case, then perhaps this exercise was a waste of time... Or was it?

Color me shocked – he did no such thing. Zetatech will not be thrilled, but I suppose that’s my cross to bear. However, I dare say you could have informed me earlier, V. At least you secured the schematics – contract closed.
He did not. We will have to make do with the schematics. The contract is closed – but next time, V, I would appreciate hearing from you directly.
I suppose I wished to hear it from the horse’s mouth. Your payment should arrive soon.
I commend your work, V. Your payment is on its way.

Influencer\n\nYou've left a strong impression. Folks on the street know you now. Young guns at bars boast that you're close chooms. Seasoned vets name-drop you to land a better cut from their fixer. You drag a tail of intrigue behind you like a brilliant comet, and many try to bask in your glow. Maintain that momentum, and you'll become a local icon before long.

Fame\n\nEveryone's got a job lined up for you, 'cause they know you're the one to do it right. Clients who require a pro's touch drop your name to fixers. Those fixers are happy to oblige, and use you to bump up the client's fee. A "fame tax," they call it. Cha-ching – everyone's a winner. That's the biz of becoming a brand, baby.

Glory\n\nThe finest rides and the shiniest toys are at your fingertips. The eddies are rolling in, but is it enough? The space between "good" and "the best" is a big one, and you're starting to close the gap. Don't stop now – you're on a ride anyone in this godforsaken city would kill for, and you're holding the golden ticket.

The Oath\n\nPledging yourself to stale national ideals…? Talk about cliché. Not to mention old-fashioned. You have your own reasons to act. Now's not the time to be playing someone's puppet. Your time's far too valuable, and you both know it. Dying in the service of some NUS politico? Yeah... thanks, but no thanks.

American Blues\n\nSeeing all those faces plastered on that tree in Dogtown confirmed one thing – there is no grand plan, only the individual and their inevitable demise. And sometimes there's just no making any sense of it – no matter how hard you try. Friendship? Loyalty? Ambition? In the end, only cynicism remains. On its own, the feeling doesn't inspire much hope, but by sharing it, the two of you have grown closer. And that has to count for something.

Ray of Hope\n\nThat was some heavy shit, and you hate to call it a sigh of relief, but there's no denying it's given Johnny a light at the end of the tunnel. Even with the heavy cloud over head, a ray of hope shines through. There isn't always a path to freedom, but there's no telling what the future holds for you two. What would Songbird have done in your place?

Fuck the System\n\nNo way in hell you could turn her in. You've been saluting the system with your middle finger all your life. If anyone's got a shot of escaping captivity and this neon-soaked hellhole, they deserve your help. Your help and Johnny's. It was a must-do move, personal motivations aside, and Johnny understands that all too well.

Uphill Climb\n\nAnother promise of survival and another unknown. But can you really afford to pass on this lead? As long as your heart beats and your mind is sharp, every opportunity is worth exploring. No matter how high the stakes climb.

Respite\n\nRest a sec. Catch your breath. You can't keep up at your current pace. But now that you've seized this opportunity, don't let it slip through your fingers. You landed square in the middle of a geopolitical clusterfuck on a scale larger than you could have ever imagined. Whether running this gauntlet will be worth it in the end... that remains to be seen.

Breathless\n\nEverything's blurring together, but where there's a plan, there is still hope. Keep your eyes on the prize. The rules of their game can be dizzying, but Songbird's promised cure may be worth the risk. It has to to be.

Running on Fumes\n\nYou're operating on pure willpower now. To give up at this moment would be to give up completely, but surrendering just isn't in your DNA. Not in Johnny's either, that's for damn sure. Keep pushing forward. Everything is still within reach.

A Better Tomorrow\n\nBreathe in… Breathe out… It was a medical success – the Relic is gone. You're on the road to recovery, and you have the rest of your life ahead of you. The only question that remains… Was it worth the price you paid?
Where'd you disappear to? Let's reconvene, Elizabeth Kress Street.
Took you for a screwup... From here on, I'll handle this on my own. Can't wait forever. Don't try to contact me.
One more thing: that spot on Liz Kress could make a decent base of operations, so to speak. You won't find anything better in Dogtown. Should be all set up for you now. No need to thank me.
Reed, all good? What's going on?

With a heavy heart, we bid farewell to our dearly departed Dr. Anthony Anderson. This noble soul lost his life protecting his patients from the recent Scavenger attack on the clinic. His senseless, tragic and untimely departure leaves a big question mark hanging over the clinic's future. Without the professional knowledge, extensive experience and remarkable skills of Dr. Anderson, Haven faces an uphill battle for survival and our patients to battle for their lives.\nBut we won't give up! We want to believe that Anthony Anderson wasn't the only doctor in this city who couldn't turn a blind eye to their fellow citizens' suffering. We kindly ask that you share the news of our vacancy far and wide!

The Haven clinic is seeking skilled applicants to fulfill the role of doctor, surgeon and ripperdoc.
Requirements:
- Minimum 2 years professional experience
- Flexible working hours
- Empathetic approach toward patients
- Psychological resilience
- Motivation and engagement
- Readiness to work pro bono
- Leadership skills

We offer:
- the chance to provide real help
- satisfaction from your work
- local gratitude and respect

Julia Young and the final stretch

First it’s nothing but a bright future spread out shining before you: “You’re a once-in-a-generation talent! Amazing! Just sign on the dotted line, and we’ll turn you into the best boxer on the West Coast!” And then suddenly you’re out on the street with a second-place trophy. Worthless silver.

Fiona promised the moon to me and my parents, and they believed her. They signed the contract and packed their 11-year-old daughter off to the center. I didn’t miss them.

At the center they stuffed me with pills and chrome that made me feel like an all-powerful god. I was in heaven. High 24/7. I was the most beautiful, the smartest, the fastest, the best. Training, lessons, eat, sleep. Training, lessons, eat, sleep. And the training results you get addicted to. Your body changes each day. Every day’s a new, better version of you. You go to sleep earlier so the next day comes sooner and you can look in the mirror and admire your ever more sculpted muscles, your veins ready to pop out of your skin, your shining new chrome.

I was a god. I was on top. I was everything, I had everything, I achieved everything. I destroyed the other boxers. I raised my arms over my downed opponents and heard the crowd chanting my name. I was alive.

I had a gift. I had rhythm and an unbelievable sense of distance. I danced around those other bumbling girls, controlled their every move. Hypnotized them with my left straight, destroyed them with my right, my left hook landing right to the jaw of these falling fainting feeble little nothing boxers. I was fourteen.

But when I was sixteen, my body started saying “no.” My left arm went numb during a fight. I lost, then found out I had cyberware-induced neuropathy - my synapses were overloaded, fried. Fiona threw me out the next day.

I’m seventeen. I’m nobody. But I did klep a decent pump of phant off some scav. It’s stronger than the heaviest BD. Feels like I’m alive, I’m back in the ring, life is fucking beautiful.

Info for everyone so it’s clear to you and the clients. We got basically the same drug, but two different strengths. Deep Dive's your first little leap into the deep end. Phant's the fuckin' abyss.\nDeep Dive – how it works – it hits you like you were reliving a BD, but in real time. You imagine something and actually live through it. Like a lucid daydream you can control. No need to wait for someone else to scroll it; you can experience whatever you want. Someone tells you a story and you’re in it, man. It’s a preem trip, but you gotta be careful – if your choom tells you a shit story, could really bring you down hard. Seriously. Get a choom to tell you something nice, so you get to relive all the colors, emotions, smells, all that shit.\nPhant – how it works – now we’re bringing out the elephant guns, huh? Deep dive’s a poly one-shot compared to phant. If we’re counting, Dive’s only about 20-25% the strength of phant (depending on purity, obvi). So while Deep Dive lets you relive someone else’s experiences like they were your own, phant just punches you in the face, grabs you by the metaphorical balls and tears you away to an astral plane of pure ecstasy. We’re talking life pre-phant and post-phant, that’s it. Once you get a taste, it’s all you can think about. Pre-phant is just a sad, gray thing of the past. Chooms, I mean it, if you haven’t tried phant then you got no idea the heights of happiness you can reach. That’s pretty much it. Sincerely, your prof of psychodelic sciences, meaning me, Mikhail

entries.femaleVariant: Heeey, so I was doing a bit of inventory (drew the short straw...) and you know how it goes - mind has to stay occupied with something, and that just happens to be you. So, I dunno... Figured I'd just ask how things were going?
Not a lot happening - just chilling. Thinking of you.
I've got super-weird gig, pretty layered. I'll tell you about it later.
I'm on a contract - goes way deeper than I expected.
Riiight, so... Guess you're busy with usual work?
Well, you've got a knack for landing yourself in hot water.
V, an "I'm fine" would have sufficed. I'm starting to get worried.
Bingo, and let's just say the local authorities and I have had a few... disputes.
It's not your usual contract, plus the reward's better than E$.
You know I always land on my feet. Don't worry about a thing.
Hey, sorry - soon as I finish this job, you won't have anything more to worry about.
I'm fine - let's catch up later.
Riiiight, okay then, I won't pry. No need to explain.
Ugh, I don't know why I expected anything different. Just please be careful :)
Sheesh, okay, just wanted to talk. I'm pretty far from NC, got a bit bored, started thinking of you...
I just hope we'll get to spend a few more cozy evenings together - all the cliche romantic gestures included. So you know... don't get yourself killed, all right?
I know, I'm sorry. Job's more complicated than I thought.
That's exactly what I'm working on :) Future's starting to look bright for me again.
Really think I'd put my ass on the line instead of being on a date with you? It's an important job - I'll explain later.
Okay, not really sure what to think. Next time you don't have to be passive-aggressive - just say if you can't or don't want to talk. Like an adult.
Give me a holler when you're done :)
I'll tell you all about it when we meet, ok? It's a real page-turner.
Well now you've got me imagining all sorts of things ;)
Say no more. You have to do what you have to do <3
hey, how goes it? still think about me from time to time?
not right now, sorry. got a pretty demanding gig, need to stay focused.
I could use your input for this complicated gig I'm on right now

I respect that. Staying focused is staying safe.
If you wanna talk about, I'm here. Who knows, maybe I could even help…
Well now you HAVE to give me details…!
there's still a lot I don't know. it's a complex sitch. I'll tell you everything later
well, I guess I'm basically a bodyguard. one-time thing, but with the potential for future cooperation.
oh you know - just a cozy evening together :)

Not an appropriate subject for the holo, hm? I get it.

All good, understood. You've got your secrets, I've got one or two of my own ;)
Definitely not. But maybe sometime over a drink…?
Definitely not right now. Eyes and ears everywhere.
Instead of saying sorry, I could make it up to you by helping you reenact that scene in real life…?
Just remember that no matter what the job is or who it's for - your safety's most important
Gig I'm on's pretty layered, complex - maybe another time…? I'll hit you up, don't worry ;)
can't spill detes, but it's not the best time. for now we'll have to settle for fantasies
let's leave it at that :) I'll catch up with you later, promise
I just hope all's good between us. Next time just give me a sign, anything, that you're still alive…
I get it. Do what you have to do.
In my experience, sacrificing too much on someone's behalf rarely pays off. People's gratitude is usually shortlived and the money doesn't last forever.
I know, I know. I'll explain everything some other time.
No need for the lecture - I got this.
Course, I'll let you get back to it. We'll catch up later. Maybe over dinner, who knows ;)
Course, I never doubted you. I just hope we'll meet up soon to chat…
I'll try. you too - I'll make sure to check <3

Sam, people die, loves are lost, things pass. That’s life. You wanted to be a merc, enter the major leagues, drink at the Afterlife, but it didn’t pan out. THAT SHIT FUCKING HAPPENS. No reason to pack up and leave. Look, it might be naive as fuck to say, but honest to god man I believe it doesn’t matter how many times you win, it’s how many times you get back up, dust yourself off and keep fighting. Come on, get it together and come back. Me and the whole crew are waiting on ya, we got some heavy biz growing cold over here. Don’t keep us waiting, choom.

entries.femaleVariant: Our Dogtown streets can run rather narrow. Though, not by European standards, mind you. You’ll require a suitable vehicle – one which I happen to have arranged for you already. Collect it at your leisure. You’re very welcome.
Thanks. A good fixer thinks of everything, don’t they?
Dogtown is what Europe looks like? Sounds lovely… And thanks.

WROOBELEK: Yoooooo, looking for Dogtown’s next rager? Well buckle up, gonks, we’re going on a wild pilgrimage around Dogtown’s Stations of the Lost!

FIRST STATION: Regular meets with nova beats and preem “sweets” by that basketball court in the center of Dogtown, nestled at the very heart of our delusional journey. Strangers give you candy, you eat it, you sit back and watch as reality smooths over, the air turns fresh, the sun warm... just don’t forget to drink plenty of water!

SECOND STATION: Just a hop, skip and a jump and you’re at the scav party by Organitopia. What’s a choom to do in a sad, drab world of gray where good intentions, good words and good deeds mean nothing? Grab some phant – one whiff and you’re gone (though the world stays).

THIRD STATION: You scan that big metal sphere? The naked frame of the world, sans skin, sans brain, sans teeth, sans everything? The sharp edges that lie hidden just under reality’s veil of tears? That globe that resembles a world gone barren, the oceans turned to dust, the earth rotted off a worm-eaten skeleton of chrome as great as our longing for meaning in this mortal coil? Yeah they party there too.

FOURTH (FINAL) STATION: There’s this little teeny tiny spot in a container in the Stacks. Go ahead, crawl in, reenter the womb, dance around or lie down on the ground and pulse along with the musical contractions. Some end up staying for good, ‘cause what’s the point of leaving?

Gig objective: Rescue Anthony Anderson

Location: Haven Clinic on Montaña de Oro Ave

Details: The poor never catch a break, do they? Anderson’s clinic can barely make ends meet, and now the Scavengers are giving them hell, too. The gang has some business with the good doctor – and he couldn’t care less. He’s barricaded himself in his office; nobody in, nobody out. What’s worse, Anderson’s the only physician the clinic has. Please, speak with his assistant Odell Blanco at the scene and get this sick situation sorted.

Are our "mutual friends" happy with their new Rayfield?
They've been taken care of. No need to worry about them anymore.

June 22
It’s my 13th birthday today, my first birthday away from Night City. I’m really sad.

June 23
What do I miss? I miss having a bathroom with a shower and a toilet. I miss my room with my comfy bed and my games. I miss having a cleaning lady, I miss ordering takeout, I miss the clean air from our air purifier, I miss my friends from school. I even miss the Arasaka school and homework.

June 25
My mom and dad had another fight.

June 27
Dad came “home” to our container today and he smelled really bad. Mom said he was skezzed but he said all he had was a few drinks. Then he didn’t want to talk anymore. I was scared. Then he scrolled some braindance, mom told him to stop but he didn’t listen. Eventually he peed himself and then it smelled even worse.

June 30
Mom said if it weren’t for me she would leave dad. I don’t know what to think about that.

July 4
Some people came and robbed us. I was scared. They beat dad up.

July 5
Mom got really mad at dad today. She yelled at him that it was all his fault, that he was stupid and a shit media. Dad hit mom. I tried to stop him and he hit me too.

July 6
Dad said he was really sorry, he kept saying how sorry he was, he wouldn’t stop and honestly it was worse than when he hit me. I couldn’t look at him. He promised it wouldn’t happen again, but I dunno if I believe him.

July 7
Dad got drunk and started talking about his job at N54 News, how he used to be a real journalist, like one of the few real ones left. I asked him why we ended up here then and he said “sometimes, when you do the right thing, you do something stupid.”

July 8
Mom said I have to go work at the stadium too, we don’t have enough money.

July 9
I started working at a medstore, they make me go from one vendor to another since everyone needs something, it’s like all these people are sick but they all look fine to me.

July 10
I brought my day’s pay home but now I can’t find it

July 11
Dad stole it. Mom started yelling at him again, she said he wasn’t a media, he was just a no good thief, that a real journalist would know what not to write so they don’t lose their job. Dad hit mom again. I didn’t do anything to stop him. I feel like a coward. I miss my friends.

It seems someone rebranded the stadium and lived to tell the tale. My congratulations to them, whoever they may be. In worse news, Kurt Hansen caught the proverbial stray bullet. He’s dead. Whether it was his competition or some ambitious underling, an unknown someone sensed the opportunity and fired. I do know what his death spells for Dogtown – trouble. I’ll be in touch soon.

Attention! As you may have noticed, Dogtown has an infestation problem. If you see anyone with a spray can or poster in hand... you know what to do. If you hear anyone shouting suspicious words or phrases – same thing. It's time to clean up Dogtown, so grab your shovels and get this shit off our streets.\n\nLt. Col. Bennett

Following the death of Col. Hansen, our organization now finds itself in a dire situation and at a critical crossroads. Your commander, Lt. Col. Bennett excels at one thing and one thing alone – doing the dirty work. But being the leader of BARGHEST requires more. His reign would drown Dogtown in blood and destroy what Hansen built. It's not too late to choose the right side.

If you're reading this, consider what you stand to lose and, more importantly, what you stand to gain. I don't need to remind you whose hand steers BARGHEST's finances. It is a hand that gives, not one that takes away... Provided you make the right choice. Join us today – tomorrow might be too late.

J.

Mr. Hands,

As promised, here's my assessment of the current situation inside BARGHEST:
COLOSSAL CLUSTERFUCK.

The entire organization is beginning to crack from top to bottom. I know I don't need to explain to you the kind of people we're dealing with here. But I guess that is kinda what you're paying me for, so here goes:

Bennett the Brute is trying to consolidate his power, clearly gearing up for something big. If he feels confident he can eliminate an internal rival, I doubt he'll hesitate a second. Today he strangled some smartmouth with his bare hands because he questioned Bennett's leadership credentials. So yeah, thought that was pretty telling of his current state of mind.

Meanwhile, that cagey accountant, Jago, has been mostly sticking to the shadows. Still, I guarantee he's up to something on the side. All signs point to him strengthening his ties with gangs that have any meaningful presence in Dogtown – the local Voodoo Boys, in particular. He's clearly looking to carve out a big piece of the pie for himself. Hell, maybe the whole damn thing. Tough to say at this point.

From my own humble perspective, I just know i don't wanna be here when those two decide they're ready to enter the ring and go for each other's throats. The danger is very, VERY real. As a result, my daily rate just doubled.

Be in touch soon.
