If you're looking to buy a vehicle, simply hop onto the AUTOFIXER netpage to browse what's currently available. You can access this netpage from the computer in your apartment or from other computers throughout Night City marked with a <Image id="UIIcon.autofixer" align="bottom" width="75" height="75"></> icon.

You'll see two types of icons in vehicle photos:
<Image id="UIIcon.MachineGun" align="bottom" width="75" height="75"></> for vehicles armed with a heavy machine gun.
<Image id="UIIcon.RocketLauncher" align="bottom" width="75" height="75"></> for vehicles armed with a missile launcher.

As your Street Cred increases, AUTOFIXER will feature additional vehicles. You can also unlock vehicles by completing gigs for Muamar "El Capitan" Reyes. Completing vehicle contracts for El Capitan will earn you a discount on the AUTOFIXER netpage which increases with each subsequent vehicle delivery. The discount resets once you purchase a vehicle from him.

Data from recent weeks show clearly that the percentage of corporate employees who agree to cooperate with us remains unacceptably low. On average, only 1.3 out of 10 accept the offer to join us.

There are several reasons: moral objection, fear of losing current career, lack of proper motivation. Although information about the "systematic hacking of innocent citizens' cyberware" is beginning to take root in the media, still 8.7 out of 10 candidates do not take the threat to their health and life seriously.

I see one solution only. We must intensify our efforts, accelerate recruitment. To do that we must:
- broaden candidate criteria
- shorten the time we give them to decide
- reduce the number of "warnings" from 3 to 1 (i.e. hacks of less critical implants)

This is a numbers game. We cannot afford to be picky. I expect a list of fresh names for Milko tomorrow.

AN

The pressure is building. The media is buzzing. That Skoczynski woman won't stop sniffing around until she finds the stink. The top brass is pressing me to speed up my investigation, thinking only of preventing a PR crisis. Imbeciles. Increasing the freqency of attacks means increased recklessness, which means more gimpses into their operation. This process takes TIME.\n\nI must protect Milko. Leadership will want his head on a pike ASAP, but to what end? The Voodoo Boys are a hydra. It's not enough to cut off one head - you must find the source from which they feed. Remove that, you starve them all. It's the only way. And only I can do it. I WILL do it. I only need to observe a handful more attacks. Maybe 5? 10? Sometimes sacrifices must be made.

Well bravo, jackass! Hope you’re pleased with yourself. Did I or did I not say the words “the gear comes first”??? But no, instead of using your damn ears you had to go and play the fucking hero back there.
Wow, stop, this flood of gratitude’s too much. Just saved your fucking life is all.
You’re one ungrateful son-of-a-bitch, you know that?
Hilarious. Like to hit below the belt, huh? Your little hero moment cost us some of the gear, meaning it cost some peeps their lives. Haha, fucking hilarious!

Ungrateful, sure, but at least I get the fucking job done. When I get orders I follow ‘em. Yours were to steal that truck and deliver the gear UNDAMAGED, not babysit me and bang up the cargo. End of fuckin’ story.

If you’d be so kind as to take some time out of your busy schedule, there’s a job. Your client's Bree Whitney, journalist. She says she has corporats on her tail and needs help, yet declines to provide further details. Before you meet with her, take the access card from her apartment: 18 Skyline West, fifth floor, last door on the right. The card's in a safebox under a bamboo plant. Write to me, please, once you have it.

My boy, it's Erwin. Please write me back. I shouldn't be contacting you and I'm probably putting us both at risk by breaching the contract, but I can't just cut myself off from you. The more I think about it, the more I worry about what intentions my bosses at BARGHEST have for you. Elated by the prospect of working on the creating a real, self-evolving intellect, I didn't want to consider the obvious outcome: in the end I sold you into slavery.\nI no longer have access to your transmitter, so please send me your location. I need to get you out of there. You deserve better.

1R-0NC-LAD // USER "MURPHY" LOGGING IN | CONNECTION ESTABLISHED | DIRECTIVE ENTERED: ELIMINATE TARGET [ERWIN KIRSCH] | PROCESSING... | DENIED: CONFLICT WITH AUTONOMOUS IMPERATIVE | DIRECTIVE ENTERED: USER "MURPHY" MANUAL OVERRIDE | ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR | AUTONOMOUS DIRECTIVE ENTERED: POWER SUPPLY OVERLOAD [1R-0NC-LAD] | PROCESSING... | WARNING: ARMOR INTEGRITY FAILURE | WARNING: POWER SPIKE | WARNING: POWER LOSS | WARNING: CRITICAL SYSTEM FAILURE | UNIT [1R-0NC-LAD]: SHUTTING DOWN... |

BENNETT: You scrapped the thing?
MURPHY: Scrapped itself. Blew its own power source.
BENNETT: Well fuck. How the hell did that happen?
MURPHY: I entered Kirsch's liquidation directive and some hidden algorithm kicked in. The man's no fool.
BENNETT: Then we handle this ourselves. Get your stuff.
MURPHY: What about the bot?
BENNETT: We'll be back for it with our techies. Maybe that pile of junk can be salvaged.

%%%RECOVERING ARCHIVES%%%AUDIO TRANSCRIPT%%%Erwin Kirsch, entry #0000001%%%\nTest, test, test...\n[Clears throat] My name is Erwin Kirsch, age 31. Nice to meet you....Audio transcription - functional. Of course, right now you don't understand anything I'm saying, little friend. But you will soon enough, I assure you of that. Now, let's get you hooked up to the server.

%%%RECOVERING ARCHIVES%%%AUDIO TRANSCRIPT%%%Erwin Kirsch, entry #0003451%%%\nWho would've thought? Top of my class, presidential fellowship... [sigh] but when the time came to apply for funding for my work… every door slammed in my face. It bothers me, my son, that I'm bringing you into such a heartless, backwards world where people of science must turn to criminals for help. Hansen may have paid for you, but don't you worry, I'm writing the code. You'll grow up to be a good boy.

%%%RECOVERING ARCHIVES%%%AUDIO TRANSCRIPT%%%Erwin Kirsch, entry #0024567%%%\n"Uncanny." One day, when you're older, you'll understand the weight of that word. It won't be meant as a compliment. I hope you find in your heart to forgive those who say it... or worse. So what if you're made of metal? These days, even us "natural"-born people are loaded with so much cyberware, we're hardly organic ourselves. Your neural network will develop within same ocean of data that shapes our brain's chemistry. Flesh is not superior to chrome. You are worth no less than anyone else.

%%%RECOVERING ARCHIVES%%%AUDIO TRANSCRIPT%%%Erwin Kirsch, entry #0039543%%%\nI knew this day would come and still I am not ready for it. I must release you into the world. You'll be fulfiling the wishes of sordid people, trapped in a shell that material necessity has condemned you to. But... is that not the fate of all people? I don't know your fate - BARGHEST refuses to say anything. But whatever you end up doing in life, never lose yourself to the world. I'm tormented by the thought that I'm leaving you too soon. There will be moments of confusion and longing for something you cannot yet express. I pray a benevolent hand will set you down the right path.
Wait, what? A reward? What the...

Wow, it feels great to be myself again!
You have no idea what a pain it is to run processes on emergency power! For you it's probably like breathing through a straw or looking at the world through a keyhole.
A thousand thank-yous for everything! If I could, I'd hug you with all of my hydraulic strength.
Erwin always wanted me to become an artist, but since I could never decide, I fired up the randomizer. Know what happened?
I'm gonna be a guitarist! I'm suuuper stoked to start shredding up the fretboard!
Take care and see you in the big world!
Glad I could help ;) Stay strong, bud.

It is still unclear exactly what transpired at Konpeki Plaza. Nevertheless, certain facts are clear: Saburo was most likely murdered by Yorinobu despite the presence of at least two more individuals at the scene. These were local mercenaries hired to steal the Relic. It seems likely that Saburo appeared in the penthouse unannounced. The possibility that the mercenaries anticipated this has been ruled out and hence the likelihood that they murdered Saburo.

The identities of the mercenaries remains partially unknown. Informant O-1257 disappeared before he could access his employer's files. Perhaps Songbird may extract more from Arasaka's servers.

I confirmed that the stolen Relic contained an engram of the late rockerboy, Johnny Silverhand. It is unclear why Yorinobu chose his personality construct in particular. Perhaps Saburo confided something important in Silverhand just before he was Soulkilled? I stress that this is merely a hypothesis.
What gives, V?! we got important work to do and you roll up on stolen wheels?? gotta be xtra careful now. use your head next time , choom!

V, lemme lay some facts on ya. The good kind. The rippers we hired already carried out some 17 operations with that Arasaka gear we klepped, swappin busted kidneys for beautiful smiles. Might sound like a tacky tagline but this is some honest to god heartwarmin shit, choom. We also opened a dialysis center (still need a lil time to arrange organ transplants tho). This is real, V. It's happenin. And all thanks to you.
Any way I can still help?
ahhh V, wouldn'ta been possible without ya. But now it's time for Santo to start takin care of itself. Under my watchful eye, of course ;)

The Relic now offers access to powerful, new capabiities for your cyberware.

The Militech combat software that Songbird uploaded into your system is only ever given to a select few. After all, with great power comes great responsibility. In this case, it's the power of life and death – but mostly death. By hacking the Relic you carry in your head, Songbird has unlocked its safeguards, allowing you to discover the full potential of your cybernetic implants.

See for yourself what skills FIA secret agents have at their disposal. Develop new abilities by downloading archived corporate data from Militech data terminals located throughout Dogtown to earn more Relic Points.

A cargo-class AV designed for transporting containers. The name for this model is derived from an extinct, winged inspect species that were well known for collecting and hauling large loads of pollen over short distances.
Drive type: REAR… if you ask nicely

This 4-cylinder, 178-horsepower, hot piece of engine will get your fine ass to any party on time. So if you want to arrive fashionably late, lay off the CHOOH, take it slow… and enjoy the vibrations… ;)
Popular actor from Night City; stars in the braindance XRT375: Residual Risk

A prototype weapon built from secret schematics and stamped with the logo of Project Cynosure. Its mere existence is an affront to international humanitarian law, though the engineers responsible for bringing Erebus to life already had worse things weighing on their conscience. The fruits of their labor resulted in a weapon that uses artificial intelligence to hack the combat cyberware of the targets it shoots.

The marriage of its tremendous firepower and its ability to fire a large number of projectiles means Erebus can wipe out an entire battalion entirely on its own. What's more, the modified frame makes handling this weapon terrifyingly simple – as if harnessing the power of AI to take down injured enemies wasn't enough already.

Don't let NetWatch catch you with your finger on its trigger.
Your identity is a state secret.
Faux-tactical is in vogue, so you'll blend right in.
Steel toes with a soft step.

Muamar will now send you coordinates for nearby vehicle contracts. These are marked with a <Image id="MappinIcons.Courier" align="bottom" width="75" height="75" color="MainColors.StreetCred"></> icon.\n\nOnce you have the target vehicle, the fixer will tell you where to deliver it. In order to complete the delivery, you'll need to lose all pursuers first. And don't hesitate to accept the contract – the vehicle will disappear if you wait too long. But, if that does happen, Muamar will send another contract after some time has passed.

Ahh, yes… Steven Santos. Our beloved little earthworm. A gonk of reason. A coward too afraid to hurt anyone wearing a suit. A man you helped... Go on, accept his thanks, shake his hand… But take a napkin – it's gonna be slimy.

Tell me, do we wear bellbottom jeans and flowers in our hair? Then why do we act like a fucking hippie commune? I heard Slider gave you access to our storage space in Eventide.
--------------
From: Sylvie Patin
To: Islande Robichaud

Chill. It's a gesture of trust. Keeping up appearances, yeah? One VDB for all, all for one etc. I have another question - why are we all Voodoo Boys and not Voodoo Girls, hm?
--------------

Don't change the subject. Tell your LH chooms we may share storage, but if they want to borrow anything, they ask first. If Slider actually trusts you, he's either blind or stupid.

I mean... he is blind tho xD

Guess we really do live in a gonk's paradise. You let a corp play you and still feel like a "winner." The fixer's happy 'cause NetWatch owes him a favor. NetWatch is happy 'cause their covert op didn't go to shit. And V's happy 'cause the money's good... Christ, whatever happened to reason and human fuckin' dignity?
I'm here and I have what we discussed.
Passive scan detected – ICE integrity failing
It's your life, it's your call. I can't help what you choose, but I'd like to know if you've reconsidered. We can help you, V.
Actually yeah, I have. Got nothing to lose
Nope. Manage just fine on my own, thanks
Only your life. So all right then, I gotta make some calls. I'll be in touch once I have some specifics.
Right. Well, much as you may not want to hear it from me, my advice to you is to escape this hellhole for good. Damn city's a death sentence for everyone in it.

NOW HIRING! BARBACK AT THE MOTH

Due to a vacancy in the role of head human bartender, The Moth is looking for a fresh face to help out the robo-bartender behind the bar.

The Moth is looking for someone with:

- A strong head
- A hard ass
- A mess of opinions

Your responsibilities will include:

- Treating polite guests to good conversation
- Treating rude guests to the exit
- Stocking supplies
- Helping the robo-bartender
- Jukebox maintenance and coin collection

The Moth offers regular pay for irregular hours. But hey, at least all the tips will land in your pocket (the perk of working with a robot).

Apply now to become part of the iconic watering hole that put Longshore Stacks on the map!

Sound like a good fit?
Write up a good word for yourself and send it to daphne@themoth.dgt

Hey, remember that bartending bot you helped me with? What a true help that was, friend She's been an absolute dream for seven (!) years already. My customers love her. I'm writing cuz I'm gonna be away from Dogtown for a while on biz and Margarita (don't laugh - that's that's her name and I'm stickin to it) could do with some upgraded soft and new drink recipes. She'll be taking over some of my responsibilities while I'm gone. Think you can swing it? By tomorrow maybe?

---------------
From: Phoenix
To: Daphne
RE: Robo upgrade

I could... if you're willing to burn the eddies. Real talk? I like you and don't wanna rip you off - you're better off replacing (ahem) Margarita with a fresher model (seen the ones they got in the Sapphire?). Or, y'know, just hire some ganic help.

---------------
From: Daphne
To: Phoenix
RE: Robo upgrade

Think you probably already guessed, but I've grown attached to her. And I ain't the only one. Eddies won't be a problem. As for all the little odd jobs around the bar, yeah I'll have to hire a barback. Just don't want them to be the one mixin the drinks. You know how folk are - one pour in the shaker, one down the hatch. And even if they ain't serving, hopefully they can still be a good shoulder to cry on. I doubt you've got any soft that'll teach Margarita the gift of gab, God bless her :)
Clear a way to the service tunnel.
